review_text: Worked for 1 year now will not do anything will not even respond... very disappointed. Was happy when it did worked we showed all of our friends what a great item it was but now it won't even set an alarm for us. Have tried reseting I and still no results.
review_title: Wish it would have worked longer than year

review_text: Update:  I recieved an email from an Amazon rep telling me that I must be doing something wrong and there's nothing wrong with my Echo.  I replied and told him that I know what I'm doing and that it loses its connection to my network and the only way to reconnect it is to unplug it and go through the setup process every other day. Why won't it remember the settings and why is it constantly dropping?  I never heard back from Amazon after I explained this to them. I would throw this Echo in the lake if my wife would let me. A waste of $180.

Echo stopped working about a month ago. I have contacted Amazon over this issue and have not received a reply. After reading the reviews I see there are many people having trouble with the power cord. I tried unplugging the Echo for 15 seconds, held the reset button on the bottom for 15 seconds yet nothing works. Seems there is a problem with the power cord. Why is it so hard to communicate with Amazon through their website? they keep the "contact us" link hidden from the public. I have looked everywhere and see nothing for live support or a phone number. WTF?
review_title: Echo stopped working about a month ago. I have ...

review_text: "Alexa, why did you stop working all of a sudden? "Alexa, please return yourself to Amazon". Nope. Our Echo decided to just die this morning. It's about a year and a half old (a gift from our son) and of course the warranty is only for a year.  Now I understand hardware very well, but this degree of low reliability coupled with the fact that I spent 45 minutes today talking to three people (support, then Echo tech support and then a "member of the leadership team") to no avail tells me that Amazon has been, is and will continue to be a lousy hardware company. We buy literally tens of thousands of dollars a year from Amazon, yet they fail to keep this customer happy by not offering to replace this dud unit and instead offering a promotion of 50%/$50 (they couldn't even get their offer straight between the two people that made offers.)
review_title: "Alexa, please don't die right after your warranty ends"

review_text: She was my gateway drug into everything Amazon, now she is a $180 paperweight Amazon refuses to fix. I was one of the first to own her.  I preordered this magnificent pillar of the future, and propped her up on my kitchen island where she still remains.  For almost a year she spoke sweet nothings to me about the weather, serenaded me when I was feeling blue, and scheduled that meeting I had with a prostitute. ( Clip of event: [...] )  Then one day she lost her voice.  She could still sense me, she lit up when I talked to her, she showed me she could still understand me when she wrote me notes on her app, but she couldn't speak.  Without giving it a second thought I tried the age old "unplug her then plug her back in" and boom, she spoke!  I figured she had too many bad memories from months of being constantly working, cache we called it.  Then several months later she had the same issue, but much more frequently.  I became heartbroken.  All her little friends I got shortly after getting her couldn't comfort me bc they weren't her. They couldn't fill the void in my soul. I got the fire stick, tablet, phone, Dot, the works... even convinced three other people to adopt her clones. I called Amazon support to help my love.  They said because she was too old, mere months past the one year mark they wouldn't fix her.  They suggested I buy another.  $180 for one years love?  Had I made a complaint the first time it happened they would've done something.  Her voice works so it is clearly a software issue, but they won't fix it.  I am being punished for getting the faulty first run model.  Please spare her, or send me her clone. I cannot live without her, and this treatment is unfair. I have been nothing, but loyal to her and her Amazon family.
review_title: Paperweight! It died just after a year, and Amazon won't help! BEWARE it has only a 1 year warranty!

review_text: Originally LOVED my Echo. I've had it for almost two years now. It worked perfectly all the time at the beginning. Over the past eight months or so, performance has significantly declined. It started to become intermittent what Alexa would hear and understand. Now it's to the point that I ask Alexa to turn the volume down and she asks me what device I am looking for. Sometimes I don't get any response at all.  It's pathetic and there's nothing I can do since Amazon only offers a one year warranty. For the cost of this device, Amazon should be offering a five year warranty. Disappointed and as much as I liked the device, I probably won't buy another to replace the one I have unless Amazon increases the length of its warranty (or decreases the price).
review_title: Gradually Loses Performance, Needs Longer Warranty Period

review_text: Very upset with Amazon right now. I have had my echo since it was released. I pre ordered it, got it after three months of waiting, worked GREAT. Then one day all of a sudden it stopped connecting to the internet. I sent an email, Amazon said they could only resolve over the phone so I set up a call. I sat on the phone for THREE HOURS going around in circles trying the same trouble shooting methods over and over again. I said to the rep MULTIPLE times that I just want a replacement. He insisted that he would get it to work. Finally he said "I think it's your internet please call your provider and have them split the bands in your network" he then stated he would call me back the following day (never called) my bands have since been split on my network and still no connection to the device. I have since then sent multiple emails and every response is "please call us for better assistance" I refuse to waste another three hours of my time doing the same things I have done over and over again and did not work. This has been going on for months now. I JUST want a working device....I am glad to send this device back. Also the cover on the top that covers the interior buttons has come off. I noticed this when I moved the device to my bed so I could clean the stand it was on and when I laid it on its side it just popped right off and will not go back on properly. (Never dropped...I take care of my things) I am absolutely exhausted with this issue. And I am seeking a true resolution!! I have added pictures as well. Please note that it's current position in the photos is not the place I normally keep the device I pulled it closer to the side for photos.

I gave this as a family gift. We set it up the day after Christmas, very excited about the possibilities. Within a few hours, the unit started making a headache-inducing buzzing noise. I figured it was an aberration and plugged it back in the next day to hear the same thing. I called Amazon customer service and talked to two different people, who said they never heard of such a thing. The bottom line is neither apologized or seemed to care that this product that was a Christmas gift was unbelievably defective on DAY ONE. The bottom line was they wanted me to send it back so they could work on it. Oh, and I had to pay $1 to get a label because I don't have a printer. What I expected from Amazon was an apology and an offer to immediately replace was obviously a defective unit. Both customer service people listened to the sound. Since I was well within the return time, I couldn't believe they expected me to send it back and then settle for a refurbished unit. Seriously? Uh, pass. I'm a 20-year Amazon customer, with two Kindles, a fire TV stick that was a disaster, Amazon Prime member, et cetera. I expected better. What a disappointment.
review_title: I expected better. What a disappointment

review_text: I absolutely LOVED my Echo. I purchased it from a large, reputable electronics retailer in April 2016. Unfortunately, it quit working a month past the warranty. The Echo stopped responding one day (no lights, sounds or any kind of response). I worked through all of the recommended steps from unplugging the Echo, unplugging my router and modem and restarting everything to performing a factory reset and trying a new power adaptor. Nothing worked. I contacted Amazon about this. Amazon confirmed that my Echo no longer worked and I was offered a 15 percent discount on the purchase of a new Echo. After spending close to $200 on a product that lasted 13 months, this offer fell flat with me. I chose to write this review to warn others that the issue with my Echo (dying after a year) is a common issue. This is a great product, but the quality isn't there. If you purchase it, be sure to get the extra warranty coverage and factor that into the total cost of the purchase. Amazon needs to do a much better job of taking care of its loyal customers. This was a huge disappointment and definitely makes me think twice about ordering a larger ticket item from Amazon.

I bought this when it first came out and was on the waiting list. I was a bit disappointed at first: the name (Alexa) could not be preprogramed and chosen. Secondly, there were limits on other applications and linking equipment. It has slowly gotten better in the number of things you can do with it and Amazon has made some effort to continue to grow its applicability.
review_title: Very good purchase. Good work Amazon!

review_text: Worked for 1 year now will not do anything will not even respond... very disappointed. Was happy when it did worked we showed all of our friends what a great item it was but now it won't even set an alarm for us. Have tried reseting I and still no results.
review_title: Wish it would have worked longer than year

review_text: It works... kind of... sometimes... but not very well.  Unable to understand requests or even hear many times, even though you are sitting 2 FEET from it.  States that music etc is not found even when you request the exact title of the album FROM the Amazon/Amazon streaming music website! i.e. "Alexa, play Gregorian chant." Alexa "I'm sorry I can't find any Gregorian chant songs"  Me, "Alexa, play Gregorian Chant for Meditation Chant Music for the Soul"  Alexa "I'm sorry I can't find Gregorian Chant for Meditation Chant Music for the Soul".  Plays the same songs over and over and over again when trying to listen to a genre like "Classical"... REALLY?! There are thousands and thousands and thousands of classical pieces of music and YET my Alexa can only find and play about 50-100 of them... even playing the exact. same. version. of Pachelbel's Canon in D multiple times in an 8-10 hour period.  The theory is great but either A) the system is not up to the demands yet and thus it is a toy/novelty really or B) my Alexa is the flawed/damaged version of AI for Amazon.  Really REALLY! wanted it to be great but so far.... not so much.  If it was within the 30 days I would return it. A for effort Amazon but about a D for actualization.

The Amazon Echo line of Alexa enabled devices are great, but the Alexa service itself leave a lot to be desired, making the Amazon Echo devices not as useful or valuable as you might originally think.
review_title: Entertainment use only, Alexa not reliable, not worth the cost

review_text: Honestly this thing has gotten worse.  When I first got it, it responded quickly every time I started a sentence with Alexa.  Now I have to say alexa two or three times to get it's attention, and I have to repeat myself much more.  It's like it's gotten dumber.  The directional light for the mic is wrong 90% of the time, when it used to be dead on.  I've moved it around to see if different locations would help to no avail.
review_title: Don't bother, you don't need the frustration.

review_text: Let me start by saying I LOVE ALEXA! However i don't know if it is a way to make you buy the newer one or not, but as soon as the new versions got released my echo has decided it is going to start having problems. Now when playing music or anything else it plays for about 30 sec to a minute then pauses for about 30 sec to a minute. It is only a little over a year old, so this is not OK!  For 179$ and from a maker such as Amazon you would expect that their items would last longer then a year! I am so disappointed. I can not see investing in another one for a year. I have 2 other dots and a google home and 2 google minis.  I loved the echo the best, it has the best sound over any of them. I am so upset that just over a year and now my echo can be used as a paper weight. THIS IS NOT OK!  So disappointed in the Echo!!
review_title: SO Disappointed in the lifespan of ECHO

review_text: [Edit - update 91/12017] I've downgraded this from 4 stars to 1. For 3 reasons.
review_title: When it works, it's the same as a Dot, just 5 times the size, with loudness/bass to match. But if it breaks after 30 days..

review_text: My Echo is terrible. It loses it's WiFi connection on a regular basis. I have tried resetting to factory multiple times. When going thru setup it takes multiple tries to get it to appear on devices wifi (we have three iPhones and two iPads and it does not show on any of them.). When it does finally show up it can't see the network with it sitting next to the router. I am a retired IT manager and I know how to set up devices. This device is extremely frustrating. I love the concept I just wish it worked.

It worked for one day and then it didn't work at all. It's a WiFi issue, with a very complicated fix.  A fix that I just don't have time to muddle through.  It's just supposed to work.  They want me to split my WiFi blah blah blah, come on Amazon, do better.  If it worked fine one day there is no reason it shouldn't have worked after that, so now it just sits on my desk.  I wanted to like it, and I did, or one day.
review_title: do better. If it worked fine one day there is ...

review_text: This product has proven to be unbelievably disappointing. At first, the Echo was interesting and a useful home tool. However, after the first few weeks, my wife and I found ourselves really wondering what use their could be for Alexa, besides creating lists, listening to the radio/news, and playing the occasional game of Jeopardy (all things that could be easily done on a smart phone or a computer, but were still cool to do on this new toy). So, that was when we really began diving into trying out the skills that the Alexa app had to offer, but most of them still leave something to be desired.
review_title: Gets More and More Aggravating Each Day

review_text: I love Amazon, but this product needs lot of work.
review_title: I love Amazon, but this product needs lot of work.

review_text: I loved my new Echo for the one day that it worked!  Since the day after Christmas it kept needing to be re-setup everytime I used it, until today when it stopped working all together!  After spending over an hour on the phone with Amazon Echo customer service they decided that the microphone was faulty and had stopped working.  They are sending me a new one but not until Jan 30th!!!  That means I have to wait 25 days for the replacement.  I am amazed that Amazon did not stock some for replacements when there is bound to be some number of defective units.  I consider that to be a poor customer service decision.
review_title: Only worked properly for one day

review_text: I was very dismayed by the quality of product and lack of competence in the packaging.  Number one, the Echo did not work upon arrival and Number two, the power supply provided was simply the wrong unit.  After struggling several hours to get it operational (I was lucky enough to have an alternate power supply that worked) I finally gave up and called Amazon for help.  After about an hour of phone time Amazon finally agreed that the Echo was non-operational and provided the means to return it.  The original Echo had taken 10 days to arrive and the replacement took an additional 5 days, as it was to be a gift, the lengthy delay was quite inconvenient. When the replacement did come, it appeared to be new and unused and worked instantly right out of the box.  Bottom line, I felt a bit jerked around by the shoddy packaging, malfunction and long delay from purchase to usefulness but the fact the I got a new unit the performs flawlessly for the cost of a refurb solved the wounds a bit.

Was very happy with my Alexa until she suddenly started communicating erratically and not connecting to the internet. Not a connection problem in my home. All other electronics are connected to the internet with no problems. I tried resetting and unplugging but would still have the same problem. I purchased her 5/13/2017 today is 6/8/2017, not even a month, and i'm putting in a request for an exchange. Will see how the replacement holds up.

The basic function of Alexa is very good, that is playing music, telling time, setting timers and such. But it seems that almost every functional thing beyond the basics requires a smart phone or Android device of the latest OS or Apple and they have to be got from third parties through Google Play or Apple.  My problem is I don't have a smart phone and my Android device isn't of the needed vintage.
review_title: The basic function of Alexa is very good, that is playing music

review_text: This device does not connect out-of-the-box to my dual-band network which supports ipads, cell phones, laptop PCs, TiVos, Rokus, Kindles, and any other device we or our guest connect to it.  From level 2 tech support, after an hour on the phone (and several hours of trying to get this thing to work, turning off all other wireless devices), this is what I am supposed to do:
review_title: Should Work Out-of-the-Box on a Highly-Compatible Dual-Band Network

review_text: I live in Jamaica and wanted to be able to enjoy the Amazon Echo experience.  I actually ordered one only find out that this device does not work in my country.  As a loyal and frequent customer of Amazon I was extremely disappointed that you don't seem to value your customers outside of the US. I'm so very disappointed. Now I'll have to wait and see what Google Home does for it's overseas customers.

Just spent an hour + trying to get it ip and running. Tried to download app with 2 different Fires. No luck. Also took me half an hour to get it out of the box. Whoever packed it is a moron, as am I for buying it. I suspect the idea is you can't return what you can't repack..
review_title: Just spent an hour + trying to get it ip ...

review_text: So I purchased this awhile back and it was useful for me for news, weather, set timer and playing my purchased Amazon Prime Music, until recently.
review_title: DO NOT BUY - It will not play my purchased Amazon Prime Music ANYMORE. I'M NOT SURE WHAT WENT WRONG.

review_text: As of January 2018, this device no longer connects to my hidden wifi network. It had worked prior to whatever firmware update was automatically pushed that month. Tech support is aware and unwilling to allow a fix. This is concerning for a number of reasons. First of all, the inability to roll back to an earlier firmware to uncripple the device (I can't even use it as a Bluetooth speaker if it's not connected to the internet, which is also a special kind of stupid). Second, the device was less than 3 years old and I had paid MORE for it than newer versions of refurbished Echo devices, which would lead me to believe the value of this product is greater than newer versions. It's clear to me that Amazon does not support its customers and is unwilling to solve the problem by either replacing the device or fixing the firmware issue. Google Home never gave me these issues. I've spend countless hours between tech support and trying to set up the device in vain.

I have purchased 9 Amazon Echo devices and about 50 Lutron Caseta switches and dimmers to automate my home with voice control. Everything was working perfectly until the night before last when Amazon Alexa began reporting every single Lutron Caseta device as "not responding... check its internet connection and power supply." Interestingly, all the Lutron Caseta devices work perfectly when controlled by the Lutron Caseta app on my Android phone. I contacted Amazon Technical Support yesterday. The Amazon technician confirmed they are having problems with Alexa voice controlling Lutron Caseta devices and they are working on it. He suggested I give them a couple hours. 24 hours later and it is still not working!
review_title: Amazon Echo no longer voice controlling Lutron Caseta wall or table switches or dimmers

review_text: You want to subscribe to fee-based services.  Our relationship started out great, with a decent onboarding & setup experience.  And the conversation was good; Alexa had plenty to say and often was quick to answer tough questions.  But something happened after a few months.  Maybe she got tired of me and my family.  Maybe she needed more from our relationship.  Like in the form of currency.  My money to be sure.

I simply cannot understand the love for this product.  I have a long list of gripes, but for starters the speaker is horrible... when it even wants to work.  Half the time the Echo will not sync so I have to go into settings and mess around and try and remember to find the correct links to sync; TOTAL TIME WASTER AND NOT HELPFUL.
review_title: Junk... Did It Really Have To Be Designed And Built This Poorly?

review_text: Echo does everything great EXCEPT THAT IT DOES NOT SHUFFLE MY ENTIRE MUSIC LIBRARY!!!! It plays songs whose artists begin with a number, the letter A, or the letter Z, or Recently uploaded songs, and that's it!!!!!!  It will play the same songs over and over again when I ask Alexa to shuffle songs (I have several thousand songs loaded to my Amazon account).  I've called Amazon several times and they say they are working on it (BTW Amazon customer service center is located in Costa Rica and the operators are very difficult to understand). This has been going on for about a year now and they have not fixed this terribly annoying problem.  I have seen other discussions in the Kindle forum about this, so I know there are lots of others experiencing the same problem.  Can anyone out there help?
review_title: Echo Does Not Shuffle Entire Music Library!!!!!

review_text: Update - This was received September 6, 2017. In late January, 2018 the speaker stopped working. I can unplug it and plug it back in and it works again. Then, after time, there is a pop and the sound stops working again. Everything worked like it was responding, but no sound. I sent it back to Amazon for repair, but when I got it back, it still had the same problem. They said all diagnostics stated it was repaired. It is not. Without sound, it is useless.
review_title: Fun and Useful Device, When It Works

review_text: I had it for over two years and I have tried to like it.
review_title: Worthless for me,I was better off without her! Echo never understood me!!

review_text: I purchased a refurbished Amazon echo first generation, to add to my original first generation my second generation.and my two echo show devices. I put my trust in Amazon to buy the refurbished device , But after hooking it up it would not stay connected to the Internet. Regardless of where I moved it in the house, or exchange this location with other working devices, it would not stay connected to the Internet. I initiated a replacement request well before the expiration date.  The Amazon technician put me through the hoops of unplugging it, resetting it to factory settings, rebooting it multiple times, having me connect to a different Wi-Fi, (I even ordered a new Wi-Fi service with 10 times the band  with and download speed.) Which cost me an extra $50 a month! After multiple attempts at everything they suggested I told the representative I just wanted it replaced.  She had me give her all the information from my Internet provider about their radio signal their security system even the hardware and software versions of the companies router. Unfortunately last week I had a heart attack and had to be in the  hospital for three days. They tried to contact me while I was in the hospital once again to fiddle with this adjustments in settings of which there really are none and I told them I couldn't speak because I was in the hospital. This morning they contacted me again after being released and having reached my  Frustration of jumping through hoops and doing the same things for the fourth and fifth time I just said to them I'm tired of dealing with this either send me a replacement or I'll just throw this one in the garbage. And their response was we can't send you a replacement, because now it's outside the 30 day window!

I have the Amazon Echo and two Echo Dots.  I also have a Google Home Mini.  To be honest, I think I'm going to sell all my Amazon Echo devices and just switch wholesale to Google Home.  I have a smart house (Nest Thermostat, Nest Cameras, assorted smart switches and smart light bulbs, etc.)  To be honest, both Amazon Echo and Google Home controls them just fine.  In fact, I actually like how Google Home operates.  For example, I can name one light the "Bedroom Light" and another the "Bedroom Desk Light".  With just one command, "Hey Google, turn on the bedroom lights", I can turn on both.  Or I can turn them on individually by giving the exact name.  When I give this command to Alexa, it will ask me which device, saying that I have more than one device named this.  Also, Google Home has routines so I can turn off all my lights, set an alarm, and play some sleep sounds for going to sleep among other things.  Also, Amazon Echo does not work with Google Music (I kind of expected this) or Amazon's own bought music (you have to subscribe to Amazon Music).  But Google Music is so much better with the free option, giving you 50,000 songs to upload.  Amazon keeps scaling back their free services, namely the Amazon Music uploading and Amazon Cloud Drive (used to be unlimited storage and then scaled WAY back), so generally Amazon is getting worse.
review_title: Privacy concerns and doesn't work with my Google Music collection

review_text: Item worked ok out of the box, but soon started to experience intermittent connection issues.  Every other wi-fi enabled device in my home had no issues, so it was not the network.  At first, a reset would remedy the issue.  Eventually, after a couple months, it would not connect to wi-fi at all, despite the app telling me it was connected.  Tried numerous troubleshooting methods, reinstalled app, setting up as if it were new, factory reset, etc.  Still just an orange ring and no activity.  So, put in for a refund/replacement and first e-mail gives me troubleshooting tips (that have all been previously attempted with no luck).  Second request for a replacement or refund gets me an e-mail that I have to call on the phone.  Unfortunately, working very long and odd hours I put the call in from work.  Despite telling the operator that I have tried every single thing that he suggests to me, he refuses to offer me a replacement or refund unless I am physically with the device and trying AGAIN the exact things I have tried before multiple times, but with him on the line.  I am tech savvy and not an idiot.  But Amazon seems to want to treat me like one if it gets them out of providing service.  I am a long time customer and have placed about 70 orders in the last 6 months as well as being a Prime subscriber.  But if this is how Amazon treats their loyal consumers, I think I will have to take my business elsewhere.  At this point, I may just throw the Echo against the nearest wall and wait for Google's device to arrive.  And really, even when the Echo worked, it really didn't offer much other than the weather and sports scores.  The light switch control can be done with a Wemo app without even needing it.  Sorely disappointed in this poorly constructed gimmick.  Even more disappointed that Amazon seems to want to spend more effort jerking me around than actually resolve my issue with their defective product.
review_title: Defective item, worse support from Amazon

review_text: Pretty disappointing. Only thing we can somewhat reliably get it to do is play music. Even the weather is from a different town.
review_title: Don't expect this to work like it does in the ads

review_text: Great product until you need support. So be warned if anything goes wrong with it after 1 year. Amazon will only offer a $10 - $20 discount on a new one. They are not interested in improving their product by inspecting defective devices. I had an issue they never saw before. It was a little red light on the ring about 1" long and the Bluetooth would continually  go out and back on while playing songs. I lost some faith in Amazon today. Hopefully this is an isolated incident but I will be less of an Amazon promoter based on this experience (4 phone calls an hours of wasted time running their tests. I did them all only to find out they would not do anything to help)

My Patience has WORN THIN ! Since my Last Review.  I do wish Alexa could Tell me what's on the local Over the air T.V . Or Better Understand me.. I have been using the Voice training and so Far It's NOT Helping. . i do like the feature ask wikipedia .
review_title: I am Not Happy ...I have the Echo, The Remote,And The Dot. I am Frankley Tired of Having to Attempt to Learn Echo Language !

review_text: Alexa has begun to talk too much. It small talks, greets me, tells me to have a nice day. I ask it a question, and instead of just answering, it elaborates with small talk that interrupts the flow of what I'm doing. My complaint is that there's no way to turn this feature off.
review_title: Computer small talk wastes time wastes my time

review_text: I would call this an eye opening purchase. I've used the Echo for quite a while and have loved it. It worked flawlessly and was an excellent device for the time it functioned. After it sitting on a shelf for over a year. It mysteriously lost all function. No lights, no sound, acted as though it was not receiving power. I tried multiple adapters and the "reset" button, followed the troubleshooting procedure and to no avail. Then I called Amazon's support team to what I would expect to be a straightforward replacement situation where the device had a fault and had failed. 2 hours and 7 people later all they could offer was a slight discount on purchasing a new echo...I'm not impressed. I have always utilized Amazon and their devices. I was a devout and loyal customer, after this experience I am surely shaken. I would not recommend this product to anyone who feels they should get more than 1 year usage out of it, as should it fail. You will be out the money and if you want a discount on your failed device a few hours of your time and quite a few redundant conversations with incompetent support staff. Amazon, my far you have fallen in my eyes. Buy a different device from another brand such as the google home, way lower price and you get the same type of support...I paid more, because I expected more from Amazon. Lesson Learned.
review_title: Unexpectedly died. Zero support. No Replacement. Not worth the price.

review_text: Ordered our Echo in January of 2015, it shipped at the end of May 2015, and by May 2017 it's dead!!! Spoke with Echo support who informed me it is out of warranty, but they are 98% sure it only needs a new Power Adapter, so I ordered one. They got me for another $20.

Generally speaking for the last couple of years the Echo/Alexa combination has been "5 Stars".  Until the last couple of months.  Alexa application no longer supports legacy Android 5.0 software (is it a crime to have a smartphone Note3 that is still terrific but only has Android 5.0?)  In any case the Echo does not "see" or connect to either 2.4Ghz or 5 Ghz wifi networks at all!  Notwithstanding creating new wife SSID's etc.  Did I mention that I have 2 (two) different Echo's and the same behavior on BOTH of them.  VERY DISAPPOINTING AMAZON that the best your support people can say is that they will call when a solution is found.  It's been about a month now - - - Here's an idea RMA the first generation stinkware and put us back on the "happy 5 star customer" positive reviewer list.  Are you getting the idea I am not happy with the regression testing Amazon developers are doing with Echo first generation?????  I am not.
review_title: Used to work - but now "developers are working on the problem and will call you when resolved..."

review_text: I purchased this Amazon Echo for my dad after he saw mine in action and just HAD to have one. He loved having the flash news brief in the morning, weather update always available, and his favorite music at the tip of his tongue. I surprised him with Alexa and set her up (super easy) and downloaded the app for him as well. At first the sound was crisp, the responsiveness was quick, and commands were followed. I would talk to him often and he'd always mention Alexa and how great she was.
review_title: Worked great for a few months...

review_text: I have three of these (two echoes and one echo dot). After 4 months the speaker stopped working in one of them after each 4 hours of use. I have to unplug and restart the device to make it work.
review_title: and after multiple calls and wasted time I'm still nowhere

review_text: Not thrilled. The idea is great and I really looked forward to hearing books on tape, music and interacting with it. And when all is working, it's got good sound and is really convenient with great features. For me, it is frequently unable to connect or is otherwise unavailable. The tech support feature is ok. They generally send you a list of things you can do to solve the problem. And when it is unable to connect she is not kidding. You can't even connect via Bluetooth. Ugh. I just wanted to listen to my book!
review_title: Good when it works; not when it doesn't.

review_text: I was really enjoying the echo as I just received it yesterday. It was working well for about 12 hours. Now every time I play music it just randomly stops playing it. Going to try a few things and hope it gets resolved otherwise it's going back.

Ive had this thing since they first designed and shipped them. I was one of the pilot testers. I like the idea, don’t get me wrong but, it’s the implementation that is forced upon you now. I now have to upload my phone number and contacts to use the app that is required have to access to the lists I’ve made. I have already heard stories of it calling people when it shouldn’t, let alone it wanting to invade my whole life via shopping, search queries, and other interests. I don’t need or want it making phone calls - EVER! Also, I really disagree with these forced integration policies that companies are making nowadays. There are a lot of cool tricks that this thing can do but, it should be your choice as to how much information you want to give and what features that you want to utilize. All these things in addition to the extreme liberal propaganda it now spews is getting to be a problem. Just ask it how many genders there are... I know no doctor that will tell you more than what you can count on one hand. I wouldn’t even want this thing around kids, it’s so bad. A bane, if you will. If this goes on much longer, I may just have to recycle it. I wouldn’t want to make it easy for anyone else to invite the vampires in. I’m just waiting for the smart toilets to get on the market to tell me that I haven’t gotten enough fiber or let me know that there’s too much fat in my diet. Of all the smart home ideas I’ve seen or heard of, avoiding this product might be one of the smartest.

I was super excited when my echo was delivered. I unboxed and unwrapped it only to find that the power adapter is not included. Selling a product like this without the means to get power to it goes against industry standard. I may have missed it, but I couldn't find where this was stated in the product description either-- I shouldn't have had to look anyways because this is an electronic device that has to be plugged in to work. Considering Amazon will gladly sell you the powercord for 20 more dollars, it's quite slimy. I guess Amazon wins this round.

The product stopped working after the second day. It no longer produced any sound whatsoever. I sent it back for a refund, so that I may get another current one, but it’s still pending... a month later and the return period has closed.

We bought this Echo device in the Spring of 2017 after great experiences with our other Echo devices and love of the Amazon platform. This device was a little buggy, so we put it in a room we don't typically use. About six months ago we moved it to our kitchen. Unfortunately, every few days it needs to be reset, which severely limits its functionality.  We are looking for a new voice assistant now and are reluctant to try an Echo again because we are past the customer support window. It is clearly a defective device and it is unfortunate that there's no longer support for it.
review_title: Echo device needs to be reset every several days

review_text: Wow Amazon, I am so disappointed.  I bought an Echo to compare to a recently-purchased Google Home.  The Home's setup took literally less than 2 minutes and went flawlessly.  The Echo wouldn't set up, the app kept going back to the connection screen.  After far too much time exploring answers on Google I got it connected before opening the app.  So the Echo responded to Alexa and worked as expected, but the iOS app on my iPhone and iPad keeps going back to the "Begin Setup" screens and loops through that over and over.  I finally called Amazon and was told that their Alexa app doesn't work with the new version of iOS released a week and half ago.  I tried to go to alexa.amazon.com on both Safari and Chrome and get the same screen as the app.
review_title: Can't Use Alexa App with iOS or Mac OS

review_text: We invested in quite a few of these devices, and it was working fine... of course, it had glitches, but it was still pretty cool.

These units apparently all have the same defect of suddenly not responding and/or stopping while playing, then will not restart without unplugging the unit and plugging it back in.  This happened on our prior unit, and I presumed it had somehow become damaged.  So I bought this refurbished unit (because no new ones were available), and it does the same thing.  I have determined that it is most definitely not an issue of our wifi signal dropping, as it is a hearty and consistent signal on every other device we use.  I think it has something to do with an Echo update, as this refurbished unit worked just fine until Amazon on it's own updated it (which the Echo announced).  Very frustrating and waste of money.

Hardly used, mostly to play Tunein radio. Suddenly it cannot connect to wifi anymore. Tried everything, including deregistration, factory reset, 3 different phones, etc. Just threw it in garbage. After the Amazon fire phone fiasco (useless phone now, Amazon didn't even provide an update in years. Why didn't Amazon, at the very least, give the customers the option and software to switch to Android? ), a couple of older fire tvs which are so slow now they are practically unusable, I am very skeptical about buying anymore Amazon hardware in the future.
review_title: Wifi died, useless, to trash it went. BMW, big mone vwasted
We don’t love Alexa at all.

review_text: Worst setup experience of my life. Absolute worst. Continued to get error code 10:2:5:35:1, no information about error code online. I called customer support and they gave me a list of UDP ports to unblock. I unblocked every port on my routers firewall and it still didn't work. I've tried it on multiple wifi networks and it still didn't work. I returned the echo and got a new one and, again, still having the issues. I really wanted to like the echo, but this has been a miserable experience and it is STILL not working.
review_title: Terrible setup. 10 hours, 2 devices (returned the first & reordered), days of pain and still not working

review_text: **just read an article that says Echo records everything even when you're not talking to it!**
review_title: Anything Echo does I can do from my phone

review_text: Purchase an Echo December of 2016. Recently we had a power outage at our home and when the power restored the Echo had a blue ring just going around and around. I tried all the recommended resetting options, etc and it just keep going around and around. I called tech support today, March 21, 2018 (18 months of usage) and after doing all the recommended  steps to get it working, I was told "There is nothing we can do". So they offered me a 15% discount on purchasing a new one, since the manufacturer's warranty is only one year, so I can through away the $100.00 I paid for the original or get $15.00 off a new one. VERY UNHAPPY ABOUT THIS! If you buy one, hope it breaks in the first year.
review_title: I tried all the recommended resetting options

review_text: After about 1.5 years with my Alexa echo first-gen, which I really loved, I now have a 2lb paperweight.

After a month Echo dot wasn't working properly, after a while I called Amazon and explained the problem, they had me on the line for 1 hour, they did a few alterations from there and finally it started working. It did for 2 months and then again same problem. Finally 2 months ago it was working sporadically, I would unplug the devise and would start working again, until next day. So everyday I would go through the same routine, when I said Alexa, she didn't answer. I finally got tired and called Amazon on Sept 19, again I was on the line for about 2 hours, and they finally decided that Alexa was dead, so they told me to send her back, which I did the same day. Today is Oct 1, 2017 and no reply from Amazon. I called them back, someone from India answered and he didn't even know what an Echo Dot was, I thanked him and hung up. I called again and someone who fortunately knew what an Echo Dot was, but he couldn't find anything that would prove my problem, I waited many minutes and finally transferred me to a supervisor, again I had to explain my problem, and, finally after talking to few more people and with a tracking # they finally realized what the problem was. After about 2 hours, they said that I would receive new Echo Dot, by this time my patience was gone, and I told them that since I was inconvenienced for several months they should make me happy and send me the new Echo +. They said that that couldn't be done. I said fine, but I was very unhappy. They called me back requesting me to edit my credit card, and still don't understand why I was on the line for another 30 minutes since the credit card was the same.
This review isn't so much about the Echo and Echo Dot, it's about the Alexa app.

So, I bought this Amazon back in 2017. It is now 2018 and it has stopped working. I contacted amazon and all they can offer me is a 15% discount to buy a new one. I mean, seriously? This thing supposed to work and last longer than 1 year. It was never dropped, no liquid gotten into it, it was cared for, yet, it has stopped. I have bought many many many items from Amazon, including multiple echos, and all they can offer me is a 15% discount for an item that stopped working because it's been 1 year LOL> I get it, new echos come up but i paid money for this, and it just stopped working so I can buy a new one? Nice tactic amazon.

If I could give the Echo a NEGATIVE star, I would.  I'm guessing that all these raving reviews are from people in the first week of use.  Well I've had this thing for 4-months now and I am here to say, DON'T DO IT!
review_title: Not Ready for Prime Time!!!  Spare yourself the aggravation.

review_text: They don't make this version anymore but I'm very disappointed. This is our second echo as we already had an echo dot. Everything was fine for about a year and then the speaker just stopped working. You can talk to alexa and see it talking back with the lights flashing, but no sound comes out. We can unplug and plug it back and and it seems to work for about a day or two but then the sound shuts off again and there is no way to get it to work without unplugging it. Very frustrating that this happened right after the 1 year warranty expired. I won't by future stand alone echo products.

We had this product for over a year - we were one of the first ones to buy it, and actually used it;  but recently it fell over and the top popped off.  We could not find ANY information on Amazon or elsewhere on how to get it repaired, and so today I called Amazon Customer Service.  What a nightmare.  I spoke with multiple representatives who could not understand what I was saying and kept telling me that I needed help setting up the device.  It turns out that if the Echo is out of warranty, it's impossible to get it repaired.  I highly recommend not spending over $100 to buy a product that Amazon cannot repair for you and that no-one else can either.  I've been a Prime member for several years, and this is one of the most disappointing experiences I've ever had.  There isn't even a video to help us try putting it back together on our own.  Why build a product that no-one can repair?  Why buy it?

Worked fine for 3-4 months then started having connectivity issues.  Amazon Help was useless as I was ping-ponged around to three different people each time I tried to get help.  For two months now I have been unplugging my Router, uninstalling both apps, reinstalling both apps, resetting Alexa, unplugging Alexa... you get the picture.  At most it has worked 3 nights doing all this in last 2 months.  Totally frustrated I asked for an exchange and they ask for my credit card.  I have 15 steps to go downstairs to get my wallet, when I come back up I accidentally bump my computer and disconnect the chat.  Then I have to go through the process all over again where I have to type this entire mess into the CHAT only to be transferred 3 times and now they are offering to FIX it rather than Exchange it.  What a disaster.  Amazon GET BETTER HELP FOR DEVICES!!!
review_title: Worked fine for 3-4 months then started having connectivity issues

review_text: I returned it. The sound was distorted when I played music. I tried to ignore it thinking it was me, but someone came over today & was like wow, that's awful! I did previously buy (full price) a year ago the original 1st gen Amazon Echo with the built-in hub and the sound is amazing!!! This one...not so much :(  I'm going back to the original one with a built-in hub because I got one of the new ones and it was awful as well. Amazon needs to get it together with sound quality for people who care.

Product was great until it stopped working right after the 1 year warranty was up. Now the echo randomly stops producing any sound. I can tell it it listening because my queries show up in the Alexa app history. It isn't connected to any other device, this is a legitimate firmware) software issue that has been confirmed by many other users in forums. I have to reboot it daily to get any use out of it. Usually Amazon has impeccable customer service but they didn't seem to care about this problem. Might be worth looking at the Google home option, perhaps their quality and customer commitment is better.
review_title: Known issues yet poor product quality and customer support

review_text: Sadly, I needed to return my Echo.  It kept disconnecting, despite my following all the 'extra' steps.  Equipment should be plug and play and not require multiple sequences to work - any product from Amazon has worked flawlessly until now.

This device (two of them) will no longer stay connected. About 75% of the time when I say Alexa, I get a low-pitched ding and either ‘I can’t understand’, or ‘device lost connection’. The first ten times or so u went thru the reconnect process with Alexa app on phone. After that I started just unplug and replug with the same results. Alexa works for a while and then when I need it it’s busted again. I have an echo dot on same network and have not seen this behavior with it. Please someone find a fix.
review_title: Used to love it. Now it works less than half the time.

review_text: Its not heavy enough for a door stop but it does not work as a music device as I expected.  I have been unable to get it working and connected to wifi except accidentally a couple of time.  Even when it connects (despite saying it is not connected) it works for a short period and then announces that it cannot connect to public wifi.  I have tried it a two other houses with the same result.  When I called tech support they one time they said they could not help because Alexa is down.  If I could return this I would.  Its a big disappointment.  I use wifi for many devices at home.  This is the only device that cannot connect.  Also you can't use it with xfinity wifi which seems crazy to me.
review_title: Its a big disappointment. I use wifi for many devices at home

review_text: Echo, argh! bought it new, paid full price, and it is junk. Used it for Music, game apps, weather and general information.
review_title: Don't waste your money on Echo. Failed after 15 months, support was a study in frustration.

review_text: Been a happy customer since 2005, never have I been this unhappy. I'm completely disappointed that this item stopped working after a few months - of course past my return period.  I feel duped.  Reading other reviews it appears that this is not an uncommon issue, where the Echo stopped producing audio yet seems to be otherwise responsive (lighting up when you call "alexa", etc).  Of course this had to be what caused it to be refurbished in the first place. If you unplug it and replug it in, it works for a while, then hours later stops working. The worst part is I bought this for employees at my office and now 17 people thing its garbage.
review_title: Never will buy a Amazon Refurbished Product Again

review_text: Amazon Echo worked for quite a while but the other day, JUST STOPPED WORKING.  No response to command, "Alexa Stop." She just keeps on going and going to the point that we just "turned the sucker off."  Flash forward, next day.....same thing and so on and so on and so on.  Just because mine happens to be a 1st generation, for what we paid for it, it just plainly and simply should work.  This is inexcusable!!  Would NEVER even consider getting another.  A one year warranty for HOW MUCH THIS THING COST is unacceptable.  Perhaps will look into a Google device but at this point may Alexa RIP.

My Echo has will not connect to Wi-Fi and continues to complete set up and then return to set up. The Amazon customer service team was thorough and helpful, but I have spent three hours troubleshooting myself, and an hour and ten minutes with Amazon customer service and technical support. I will be patient to wait for resolution in two days, but not enjoying my Echo experience so far.

We loved our Echo. From playing 20 questions, keeping our shopping list of just the easy of playing music. Unfortunately one day we arrived home to find her unresponsive. I tried to revive her by unplugging her, and even a simple reset, but I had a feeling she was gone. I called Amazon, and while they walked me through a few simple procedures, we determined she was in fact not coming back.....  She lived such a sort live (less that 2 years) but had made such an impact on our family. We will miss her, but will most likely have to with to a google home device, as I just can't justify another $150 on a device that last less than 2 years! So hurt and Amazon's answer was to offer a messily 15% discount on the next one. I just can't put my family through the pain of loosing another device again so quickly.
review_title: Was hoping to get more that 1yr and 11 months out of a $150 item

review_text: First, let me say that the device works well, unless you are trying to use it with Sirius XM. Unfortunately for me, I bought in to the Echo technology specifically because it was advertised as working with Sirius XM. It works flawlessly with Amazon Music. But I pay a premium for Sirius XM; I like the programming, and want to use that programming with Echo. Sirius XM on Echo devices (I bought three) is a huge disappointment. If you want to use this with Sirius XM, you had best get used to hearing Alexa say, "Sorry, I am having trouble playing the music." If you report this to Amazon customer service, they will reply telling you to 1- delink your Sirius XM account, 2- uninstall the Alexa app from your phone, 3- unplug your Echo devices, 4- plug your Echo devices back in, 5- re-install the Alexa app, and 6- re-link your Sirius XM account. Yes folks, this is what they tell you EVERY TIME. Believe me when I tell you... it doesn't help. Based on my experience with this device and other music services, I can say with a high degree of certainty that it is primarily a Sirius XM problem, not an Amazon problem. But for me, the only reason I bought Echo devices was for Sirius XM. I remember when the Android app was new to Sirius XM. It took Sirius XM YEARS (no exaggeration) to get their Android app working reliably. Today it's a great app, but it was a very rocky road getting to this point. It looks like Sirius XM is going down the same road with Echo. I really don't know that I want to hang out for years until they get it right. But I'm stuck with three Echo devices; an Echo (first generation), a Dot, and a Tap. Same Sirius XM problems on all three. We'll see if it get better as time goes on. But I don't expect it to be any time soon.
review_title: Don't buy it for Siriux XM. It's a disaster. (But great for other music services.)

review_text: Don't buy one - I own 4 of these devices and they used to work fine. No more. If playing music at any level and you ask the device to do something, it no longer mutes the music, listens, and then responds to the command (as they all used to do).

You seem to have to download a lot of apps to get the full use.  I am sick of signing in with user names and passwords, and really don't have the desire to sign up and take up space on my mobile devices and manage more apps. So I find the Ecco disappointing compared to the advertisements.
Alexa, I really want to like you.  I've tried very hard to like you.  But since I cannot get you to connect to my home wi-fi, I don't think we have a future together.
review_title: Seemed like a great idea at the time ....

review_text: Our Echo died just before the warranty was up. Amazon sent us a replacement power adapter in July. It is the 1st of September and this power adapter had died. But, I cannot get a replacement power adapter unless I buy it for $19.99. I have read many review on the Echo and they all say the same thing. It died just after it went out of warranty. This is the 1st generation Echo. I think it should have lasted more than a year, don't you? Really disappointed with this product. Amazon should replace it with a reliable Echo at no charge but they won't as it only has a 1 year warranty.
review_title: Died, replaced power adapter, died again

review_text: I'm confused by all the positive reviews, this "thing" is a toy.  works barely with Hue, does not work with Nest.  Can't answer 80% of my question, fails to play ESPN news flash most of the time.  I have spent time with this "thing" and most of the time it just sits there holding the granite counter top down.  It does play music and yes can tell you the weather, big deal, I have 5 other sources for that.  It needs more sources and programming unleash this "thing" or shelve it.  really thinking this should go back.  Or maybe I take it to the office for a simple background music source.  Problem with that is the sound is not all that great, a single Play 1 from Sonos smokes this "thing" on the sound quality side of things. I'm disappointed but maybe my expectations were to high.
review_title: Problem with that is the sound is not all that great, a single Play 1 from Sonos smokes this ...

review_text: I couldn't really tell you how well Echo works considering I spent hours trying to set it up. It will not connect to my wifi. It won't even try. I have searched Amazon and watched YouTube videos and nothing has helped. Very disappointed. I wouldn't have a problem sending it back and trying a new one but Amazon is out of stock until the end of January. Not happy.
review_title: Very disappointed. I wouldn't have a problem sending it back ...

review_text: Do not count on ALEXA customer service. Echo Alexa inexplicably stopped working tonight from one half hour to the next. I fiddled with it for a bit and then looked up a customer service number only to be put on hold for a while. Of course. A long while. Of course. Then I got a voice telling me Alexa is having issues that are impacting customers but did not name the issues. Mmmm.... What to do? Is the issue the problem I'm having or something else? I waited a while on the phone and after a while the voice came back and said, "There is no one to talk to, " and hung up on me. I kid you not. Customer service hung up on me with a recording. Just how cool was that? NO ONE has ever done that before, just plain old hung up and told me to get lost. NOTHING is more frustrating than an electronic that doesn't work - you don't know if it will ever work again or whether it is completely shot - and NOTHING is more frustrating than bad - NON EXISTANT  - customer service.
review_title: Do NOT count on Amazon Echo for customer service

review_text: This device has a long way to go before it is useful. Most of the time, like 90 percent- I can't get it to do what is asked. It understands me but returns the wrong information. It has limited utility- e.g. I can't get a hourly forecast, I can only get the same forecast regardless of what is asked. I can never get it to play the music I want. I should not have to learn how to ask my Alexa questions. It should be able to follow natural speech. I find this device to be very frustrating. We have it hooked to lights, locks, etc. and even a simple task like turn on the kitchen lights is met with confusing outcomes.
New Review:

I am tech savvy, running windows 7 plus windows 10 on another platform. I downloaded the Alexa app about 6 weeks ago but cannot get it to connect to the internet after many hours of trying. This is just money thrown out. I will never recommend

review_text: I purchased this Echo (1st Gen) and it worked for a while, my daughter even purchased one, and well, all I  have to is DO NOT purchase.  The Echo now has zero power (yes, we did all the troubleshooting), of course it just now is out of warranty.  It is essentially now a $180 paper weight!  I have seen other customers posting these same issues... I wouldn't bother buying any more devices. sad, just plain sad....
review_title: Amazon's Echo is a fail and now stuck with a $180 paper weight...

review_text: I’m so disappointed and dissatisfied with both this device and Amazon customer service. I bought it 2 years ago and it just completely died. Amazon offers zero support other than getting you to buy another power adapter. I’m not sure how you can charge people nearly $200 for a device that doesn’t even hold up for 2 years. Ridiculous. Save yourself a headache and go with Google or literally any other alternative.
review_title: Don’t bother - two years and it’s dead

review_text: After a little less than a year of owning the sound stopped working properly.  Unplug, reconnect and sound works for 2-3 days then stops.  Did trouble shooting with customer service and factory reset with same results.  In forums I see that thousands of others are having the same issue, but no recall.  Since I lived with the issue for a while by just unplugging and then reconnecting the warranty has now expired.  Amazon offered me a $9.00 as a trade-in if I return and bought a new Echo.  Since this is a well know product defect and so many others are experiencing the exact same issue you would think that Amazon would want to replace/repair the defective product they produced.  One can only assume that since this issue is so wide-spread that it would cost way too much money to admit fault and replace the defective products that have been produced.

Damn thing won't stay connected to the internet for more than 10 seconds. Spent hours on customer service to get told it was my modem. Changed all sitting exactly as they instructed still not working.
review_title: Damn thing won't stay connected to the internet for more ...

review_text: Purchased for my wife.  She has it in the kitchen and uses it quite often.  Setup with a TP-Link Smart Plug that is nice and also uses many of the features like shopping list and such.
review_title: Works Great!  EATS DATA FOR NO REASON

review_text: First off the order was delivered to the wrong address. After contacting amazon, they said they would issue a refund. That never happened. After 4 days I was able to track down the neighbors that it was mistakenly delivered to and retrieve my order (after they helped themselves to opening all of my items). Started to hook the the "refurbished" echo, and the WiFi was not working. It wouldn't recognize and signals even though I have 2 other echo units in the house that work just fine. Contacted amazon again for help with this problem. I was on the phone with them for almost an hour before they finally agreed that it doesn't work (which I started off telling them in the begining). After being transfered 3 times to different people, their phone system hung up on me. Kinda pissed at this point. After calling them back and trying to explain from the beginning, they finally (again) agreeded to refund my money as the item was no longer in stock to replace the broken unit.

I purchased the Amazon Echo with great expectations.  I was really disappointed when I tried to use this product.  To be fair it is possible that I got a lemon or defective product because I know of so many people that love the echo.  My echo lights up in the blue light and when I ask it a question it turns off.  Other times I use the echo it works but usually it just turns off.  I've always been happy with amazon products but my experience with the echo hasn't been good.

Aug 2018 - Not yet three years and this device has become a nuisance.  It is constantly losing wifi and reconnecting to it is a total pain in the ass because you have to press a button to enter set up mode, change the network on a device to connect to the Echo, then connect to the network.  I've had to do this three times in the past 5 days.  Annoying doesn't even begin to describe it.  Was only keeping it around because of its speakers, but  I would be better off with a $20 bluetooth speaker that isn't going to keep track of what I'm up to or record my conversations.
review_title: Downgrading review  - did not stand the test of time.

review_text: I got the Echo for Christmas, and had to return it.  Initial set-up was bumpy with a snag during the connection to wi-fi, but I got past that.  The Echo worked well for about 1 day.  The next day, it was non-responsive.  According to the Alexa app, it was off-line for some reason.  So, I followed Amazon online technical instructions to trouble-shoot, which ran the gamut from powering off Echo, resetting Echo, to resetting my home wi-fi.  I Googled this error and found that it was apparently quite common.  What a shame that a device that's supposed to be smart and make our lives better and easier should be this complicated to set up and stay functional!  Amazon should take a hard and critical look at this product and consider withholding sales of this product until the technology is perfected and the kinks are ironed on. Connecting to wi-fi should be a very simple and basic things.  All my other "un-smart" devices had no problems getting connected and staying connected.  I'm extremely disappointed.  After wasting a few hours on this, I decided that this wasn't worth it and returned the product.  One more thing to consider is that I make a living with business-intelligence software development and I'm generally very tech savvy.  If a software engineer can't make this device work, what chances have the non-technical masses?  Again, deep disappointment with a product that has great potential but was poorly engineered and tested.
review_title: Extremely disappointed.  Poor product design. Shameful.

review_text: Purchased my Echo in July 2017 for use in our summer cottage.  Alexa worked fine throughout 2018 but on our return this month in 2019 she was found dead on arrival. Tested 110v wall outlet to see if there was power. Also swapped power chord from my Echo dot but it is not interchangeable. Alexa is not responsive. I suspect problem may be in the plug/transformer. I was expecting more life from this device than it provided , any information on warranty ?

July 2018 UPDATE:  Only had our Echo for a year now and for the past few months we have had to reset her daily. When you ask her a question she just sits there and thinks for 5 minutes and doesn’t says anything. Did some research and apparently this is a known issue, something about the sound board going bad or something or other. Would not recommend at all. We have several Dots and they work fine. Will not be buying an Echo again...think I’ll just stick to the Dots...they seem to last longer.
review_title: Stopped working less then a year later

review_text: I received this as a gift.  So far, I have no idea what is this for.  What it can do for me reliably is to tell me the weather, which I can easily find on the internet without yelling.  As for music, it just wants me to pay to listen to what I can instead listen for free on YouTube.  I download my own music using Amazing Music onto Echo, which took me a lot of time.  Even so, Echo has a problem keeping these music and even play them in order.  I cannot choose which songs to play too.
review_title: I have no idea what is this for.

review_text: The device works, but it stops speaking at least once per week.  This has been happening for months.  I have to unplug it, plug it back in, and wait for it to reboot.  It still controls the smart devices (turn on/off lights, tv, etc) but gives no response.  The particularly annoying piece is that I cannot order anything or set reminders/alarms and get a confirmation.  This is especially problematic with ordering, when it will normally tell you what it found, what the price is, and ask you for confirmation.  I have been hoping that a software update will fix it, but apparently this is not happening.  Very disappointed.
review_title: Alexa giving me the silent treatment.

review_text: I bought both the Echo and the Amazon Tap.  I love the Tap.  And I hate the Echo.  The Tap has a charging platform that enables you to take it alone.  The Echo has a plug, so I would never want to put it in the middle of a room as it would be unsightly.  And it gets annoying - we have to keep telling it to turn off the bluetooth (which the Echo enables) of the TV since it degrades the sound.  And, next to the TV, it sporadically starts a conversation - some combination of words must have activated it.  And it's lunacy to have both the Tap and Echo react to the word "Alexa" - honestly, what were they thinking to enable both to start chatting at their own tempo and with different types of music on their own, just by using that name?  And the Echo is always on, which bothers me.  I never know how much is going up to Amazon's cloud as we talk.

We used this product for a few months and really liked it, but then we started having problems with our internet lagging badly.  We called our internet provider for help and they saw a device that was pulling a Ton of bandwidth.  We didn’t even have it in use AND THEY SAID IT WAS UPLOADING !  UPLOADING WHAT !!  So I unplugged it and there it sits, probably a year or two now.

I have only had my Amazon Echo for 3 years and 2 months and all of a sudden it just died. Now I have a worthless paperweight. Why would I have spent almost $200 on a piece of tech that is going to fail in 3 years? I have tech that is 10 years old that I use all the time that still works. I am so disappointed in Amazon right now and am seriously considering buying Google instead. Shake on you Amazon for selling an inferior product. I trusted you.
review_title: Echo is a POS! Buy a Google Home.

review_text: Our family hardly used this device.  At most maybe one or two times in a month, but after a year of using this device the speaker breaks with Alexa unresponsive when you try to wake it.  Now I have to constantly plug and unplug the device from the electrical plug in order to call out Alexa and wake it to use this device.  Annoying...  Called customer support and offered no remedy to fix this issue as device is out of warranty.  Don't waste your money.  Poor quality.

My Echo worked for about 1 month.  Then I got the 'constant spinning blue ring' problem.  I tried to fix it using info available on the web, but then got busy at work.  I just now had time to call Amazon tech support.  Even though this is a known problem as documented on the web (i.e. the device was bad at the time and was going to have to be replaced), Amazon won't replace the device now.  Not even with a refurbished device.  They offered a 15% credit toward the purchase of a new Echo.  Why would I spend more $ on a new device when the old one didn't work after a month.  I can't recommend buying an Amazon device.

The Echo White was purchased new July 2017 and died a few days ago.  So roughly 1.5yrs a 179.99 speaker died without warning.  The echo will not turn on even with multiple attempts of troubleshooting by amazon customer service.  This echo was on a surge protector along with a few other items like my apple watch and phone.  Phone and watch are working fine and charge fine.
review_title: After a year and half...she died.

review_text: My family has been enjoying our Echo for exactly one year and 2 months. Then, all of a sudden, IT’S DEAD! We’ve tried everything to no avail. The LED light on back by where the cord plugs in is lit up so we know it’s getting power. But the ring doesn’t light up and there’s no sound. This is a real disappointment! Just checked my order to see when we ordered it and it says replacement period ended August 2! Two months ago!
review_title: Not sure if I want to buy another given what happened to the first!

review_text: While I initially enjoyed this product, and still use it often, it has started making this odd crackling static stutter noise periodically while I listen to music. It occurs in bursts of 2 seconds or so and every 10-15 seconds. Very annoying, and has completely ruined any music play on the device. The device is no longer eligible for replacement, so it looks like I am out of luck and stuck with a defective product.
Two months after the warranty expired the unit no longer would respond. It was a good novelty while it worked but would not recommend it now.

The unit I purchased from Amazon would not connect to my WIFI (8MB wireless router) after hours of attempting to set it up.  Very poor online help information available.  Returning the unit after two days.
review_title: Nice looking but will not connect to a high powered router

review_text: I don't know why we didn't return it - that's our fault - but I have one at home that we love, so then I ordered one for office and my staff and I have not been able to enjoy it for more than one single 24 hour period without it disconnecting or going out. We have called customer support and tried every 'reset' method imaginable that's been suggested to us. Honestly, we've had it for a year and a half so we should've written this review sooner, but we're a very busy office. I would not chance purchasing a refurbished one again. I'd go with a new one, or consider other alternatives. We have to unplug and plug it back in daily to get it to work and now it sometimes just stops randomly after playing music for the a mere 10-15 minutes and won't restart. This purchase was a fail.

I used to love my Alexa, I had it paired with Kasa and used it to turn my lights off and on. I recently bought a new phone and had to reinstall the Alexa app. The app has been upgraded and will not work. Now I can't use Alexa to turn off and on my lights. Worthless! Don't buy an echo until they get the app to work.
review_title: I used to love my Alexa

review_text: I've own this unit for 2 years, 2months now. It has remained on the desk of a quiet office with excellent wifi. No drops/no abuse. About 4 months ago, the top volume knob has been malfunctioning. No matter which direction it is turned (clockwise/counter clockwise) the volume only increases to VERY LOUD. To counter this, we started using voice commands to adjust volume. In the past month, the unit responds to (ANY) voice commands when addressed by 'alexa' only about 50% of the time. We now resort to unplugging the unit on a daily basis to 'reboot' the unit and it becomes responsive for about another few hours. The unit is not dusty and kept in a clean environment. We are disappointed in the quality of the unit and the promises originally advertised advertised. I'm wondering how other 'older' units are holding up.
review_title: Doesn't respond or work like it used to/as advertised.

review_text: Mine quit working after a year! And their technical Support staff is not very helpful. I have 3 and all 3 stopped working the exact same day and time. They all say "Sorry, I am having trouble understanding right now, please tray again later". No matter what I do, they won't connect, won't respond, nothing! The only thing I can surmise is that Amazon pushed an update to the devices and BRICKED mine! Now the warranty has expired by a few weeks on two of my devices so essentially I got junk! Amazon tech emailed me the simple 'reset' procedure, but it still doesn't work. Unfortunately, I can't return the Echo and now rely on Amazon for its repair/replacement under a mfg. warranty.
