review_text: Very disappointed. I bought this in September and it worked fine up until recently.  Now it won't stay on.  I like to play SiriusXM music through it all day long and it stayed connected.  Now after about 5-10 minutes she says "having trouble playing music" and turns off.  Very annoying. I tried unplugging Alexa.  I tried unplugging my modem/router.  I've tried basically everything and it just won't stay on anymore.  And not even two months later Amazon tells me I can't exchange or return it.

My brother bought this for me to help make life a little easier in some simple ways. The shopping list is awesome. For 6-8 weeks my unit worked beautifully. Played music every time I asked. Did everything I asked. Then, it stopped playing music altogether. I called. Customer serviced called right back many many times each time saying it was something wrong with the wifi at home or the operator. When I suggested exchanging the unit the idea was dismissed. "The team is still working on your issue" Then "the team" suggests exchanging unit but I have to call. So I call. Now I need all the private info about the giver of the gift- which wouldn't be such an issue except my brother is deployed across the world and 5 time zones. Would not recommend this product nor the customer service. That being said, those I spoke to were always kind, polite, and easy to understand. That is certainly appreciated. However, the fixing of the problem saga continues....... UGH!
Expensive novelty Alexa app is garbage and Alexa app and amazon music do not work togeather .Alexa app is so poorly designed.

I shouldnt have bought a refurbished one. Ive had it for about two months now. It loses its connection about 3 times a day and requires a pretty lengthy process to re-establish the wifi connection. It doesnt know almost any of the questions I ask. Which is strange because my brother has the exact same one and doesnt do that at all. His wasnt refurbished though. So basically I now have a very expensive speaker. Pretty disappointing with it to be honest. And I love Amazon products. In fact, I have bought hundreds if not thousands of items on here and I am so disappointed in this product that this is the first review I have ever written. Buy new or be warned.
review_title: It loses its connection about 3 times a day and requires a pretty lengthy process to re-establish the wifi connection

review_text: I really wanted this to work but could never set it up via the Alexa app. I could get as far as returning to the setup screen after connecting to the Echo from WiFi settings. As instructed I returned to the Alexa app, to the same screen as before and then...nothing. Screen was the same as before, with options only to cancel or if there was no orange light ring. No option to proceed with setup.  I tried pushing the action button on the Echo, unplugging Echo and trying again, deleting and reinstalling the app on both my iPhone and iPad, many times over several days, with same result.  The reviews of the app since a recent update are filled with other problems.  Really disappointed but the app makes this product unworkable. I'm returning it.
To whom it may concern-
Speakers went out in less than 2 years! I did not even use this device long enough or loud enough to warrant this failure.
Was very hopeful,

This is Bob, Terrie's main squeeze. Until this morning, I have loved having "Alexa" in my living room. She plays almost any music I ask for, is friendly, almost became a part of the family. Until this morning...when she began spitting out advertisements for music I was requesting. I DID NOT BUY AN AMAZON ECHO TO RECEIVE ADVERTISEMENTS WHEN I AM LISTENING TO MUSIC.

I have had the Echo since 2016 and it has Never worked. It will not stay connected to the internet. At the beginning it worked for a few hours then it would lose internet connection and I would go through the process to reconnect. It would work for a day then the same thing would happen. I sent a message through the app of what was happening I was instructions to delete the Alexa app and start over.  I have done this several times and it still does not work.  I’m wondering if others have had the same problem. Maybe my device is defective.

I have no idea how this performs or sounds.  After 6 hours with router setting changes, reboots and talks with customer service I have officially given up trying to get this to connect to my wifi.  The latest comment from Amazon was that the 2.4 and 5 GHz signals needed to be separated within my router.  Apparently they are the same name so the Echo is confused as to which to connect to and so it doesn't connect.  I could call my internet service provider and ask them to separate them.  I tried and of course they were no help whatsoever.  It can't possibly be worth all this trouble.  Back in the box it goes for a return.  When they actually make this easy to connect to wifi - maybe i will think about buying it.
review_title: When they actually make this easy to connect to wifi - maybe i will think ...

review_text: We had to return it because it interfered with my husbands pacemaker.  What surprised us there was no warning that this would happen.  We ordered from QVC and we listened to several different shows and once again it was never mentioned.  When we called the clinic to say the pacemaker bell was going off they showed nothing on their end.  They asked us if we had gotten anything electronic new and we responded the echo and they said that was it.  We called Amazon and they confirmed so sent back.
review_title: We had to return it because it interfered with my ...

review_text: This Echo stopped working properly about a week after use. I sent in a request to get it fixed. I sent it back in hoping to get to work. Not sure if they tried to repair it or if they sent me another refurbished one but it came back even worse. It won't respond to any requests and only will connect to bluetooth for the first ten minutes after it's been reset. Don't waste your money.

Did not work for me.  Difficult to communicate with Alexa - could not understand my words (I do not have an accent at all).  Would not turn on automatically when I provided a command.  Would turn off randomly.  I returned - it was too much of a pain.

review_text: We have had this device since 2015.  It has always worked fine with my hidden mac-secured network.  In mid-January of 2019 they evidently updated the software.  It has been unable to connect since then.  Six phone calls later and 2 to 3 hours of phone time they had me broadcast the network and do some other things.  It connected once.  Then a new error code. and another phone call.  Played around with it again and got it connected.  I hope it sticks this time.  The point is, don't break working devices with updates and then not fix the issue.

I really wanted to like this, I have given it about two months and I feel my desision has been made up.  IT SUCKS!  Alexa does not know anything.  It does not look up anything... just gives a "Hmm..I'm not sure"  It is a $100 alarm clock for my kid, which btw he doesn't get up from either!

Talked to the customer services and their way of rebooting cannot solve the issue. Eventually he said it’s past the warranty and he can give me 15% off if I buy a new one, shameless.

I purchased this to use as a bluetooth speaker as the alexa functions to me are a bit of a novelty. It plays internet music fine but the bluetooth function is absolute rubbish. My pc is a newer alienware so it is not the source of the issues.

review_text: She can't hear me anymore unless I scream. Has gotten worse and worse since day one with the device and now I have to push the button on top to get her to listen. The dots work great but echo is terrible. Not worth the cost increase. Buy a dot and hook speakers to it.

I own five Amazon Dots so I decided to get an Echo for work since I teach.  The echo can be used in class for timers and be asked simple questions.  Unfortunately, after I bought it over a year ago, I never set it up since teaching can get a little crazy.  Finally, as I cleaned up my classroom today, I saw it and decided to try to set it up.  To my sadness, it does not connect.  I try several times and the error message on the application always tell me try again later.  Since it is past the return date, I am left with a big paper weight on my desk.  Bah humbug!

I have an Echo and three Echo Dots. I am trying to get my Wink Hub 2 integrated with Echo using the Wink Alexa skill. I am using the latest Alexa iOS app 2.2.323.2 (just released) and it is so bugggy that it makes the Echo products essentially useless. Well they work OK as a talking clock, but I bought them for Smart Home integration. So far, I’m not seeing that’s a viable option with the Alexa app in as bad shape as it is.

I loved my amazon echo up until a few months ago.  Every time I try to use it to stream music from my iPhone it’s will play two or three songs and suddenly stop playing and reboot itself.  I’ve tried everything to fix it.  Resetting it to factory specs and doing the entire setup all over again was only a temporary fix.  I’m really disappointed with this product and I’m now having the same issue with the echo dots I bought less than a year ago.  I won’t be wasting my money on amazon echo again.

I have ALS and had hoped to have Alexa recognize my voice and do various tasks and answer questions for me. She does not recognize my voice at all. I have to use penetrate it on my cell phone to get Alexa to answer or awake at all. I have selected music defaults and when I ask for a song Alexa said you have no music in your library. Very frustrated with device and have no instructions that helps. Amazon support has not answered my questions.

review_text: The effectiveness is highly dependent on the internet connection quality and the state of the device.  When my computers are doing google photo upload, my Echo would not function very well.  Additionally, I have to shout in the morning multiple times to stop the alarm.  It is annoying.

Worst buy. I have two echo dots and this tower echo at hone. None of these work as desired. They abruptly stop music. Can never understand when repeating the command. And it searches crap. When asked fir lullabies, it plays rock music etc.

I've had dificulty integrating this with other "compatible" devices like Sonos speakers.  The problem is on the Echo side.  They make S/W changes that make the once compatible speaker un-compatible and don't let you fall back to the prior software version that was compatible.  What a joke.  Bad engineering, bad execution and lousy customer service. This product is not ready for the public universal consumption that it was advertised to achieve..
review_title: I've had dificulty integrating this with other "compatible" devices like Sonos speakers

review_text: Love the echo however, product stopped working just after a year so it’s non returnable blue light just comes on and spins. No warnings just stopped no happy for the price I paid it should have lasted a lot longer. Very disappointed

I bought this about 2 years ago and I bought a dot. After 2 years I can say in confidence that Alexa can't answer 90% of my questions, messes up at least 70% of my requests and doesn't work 50% of the time. I bought the Amazon For in hopes they could work together to hear but they are practically incompatible unless you want to turn music on in the other room. Not to mention the speaker on the dot is very rough. I would desperately like to trade them for a Google home.

The Echo when it works is great. I have had mine for 1 yr and 2 months and in that time the adapter had to be replaced twice and this last time the Echo will not work at all. Anazon said I had to pay to replace this unit which is ridiculous when they should have replaced it the 1st xouple of times it went down. Buyer beware. The tech is great but it has to last longer than a year. Will not buy another. Going with OK Google next. Hopefully their product will last longer.

Received my echo today after ordering one day shipping. Plugged it in and NOTHING, no lights, noise, anything... moved it to several different outlets, until I finally called customer service. They believe it is the power cord, and asked me to order a new cord. Thought I was getting a deal with a refurbished product, instead I got a broken echo and a headache.

I bought this to verbally play the music i want to hear - I have hundreds of thousands of songs in my music collection.  I was able to do that for a few months, uploaded about 100 songs which i can still hear through my echo.  As of 03-05-2018 however, I can no longer listen to anything from my personal music collection. review_text: After short period of time, Echo quits producing any sound. App shows Echo hears and responds, but no audible sound comes out of the speaker. Resetting takes time, and doesn't produce a long lasting fix.

review_text: I was so excited for this. And am just as disappointed. The echo does not understand most commands, and I dont have a speech impediment or heavy accent. It doesnt recognize my playlists on prime music. I was hoping it would be a hands free siri for home- it isnt close.
review_title: And am just as disappointed. The echo does not understand most commands

review_text: What a headache...

review_text: So today is my birthday. My husband bought me the echo as a gift. We live in the Caribbean. I have been a Prime member for years now, paying $100.00 every year and shopping constantly on Amazon. If you're buying the Echo to listen to music because you think that your paying the Prime Fees gives you access to it - BE WARNED. You are wasting your money! Prime does not provide music to Prime members outside the US making the Amazon ECHO a useless piece of plastic for users like us. It does not pair with iTunes... unless you route it through some other device (which is pointless if I already have another device to play my iTunes. Location infor and weather deets don't work outside the U.S. either (but let's be honest - no one pays $179.00 to be told the weather and time). In truth, it feels like a bit of a scam that this device is being sold to non-US Amazon Shoppers when it OBVIOUSLY cannot fulfil most of it's purpose outside the US. I am so angry about it that I think I will be cancelling my Prime Account too. I guess Happy Birthday to me. And my husband feels so disappointed that this thing ruined his birthday gift.
review_title: Prime does not provide music to Prime members outside the US making the Amazon ECHO a useless piece of plastic for users like us

review_text: After only one year, this device must be constantly unplugged and plugged in again to work.  It often loses the connecting ability even while playing my flash briefing.  It was a 5-star product until it stopped working properly.  Very disappointed.
review_title: Must Be unplugged repeatedly to work.

review_text: Worked fine until we bought and plugged in 3 dots. Quit working as soon as we pugged in three dots around the house!!!!!!!!!! total setup. Software problem obviously. Even unplugging the dots don't help now. Dots work perfect

review_text: The brand-new device never worked right!  Would be listening to music and it would just stop working not sure if it is overheating or something but it also doesn't work after a few days of non-use.  Say, Alexa, what's today's weather and she might respond but the more likely result is nothing the lights on top just "spin" and nothing happens, no weather report.  Amazon Tech support has been unable to resolve the issue so we just unplug and plug back in when we want to use the device.  It's under warranty still but Amazon wants to keep troubleshooting the device and we just wait and deal with a very frustrating device....  maybe Alexa can add sedatives to our shopping list to help us cope!
review_title: The brand-new device never worked right! Would be listening ...

review_text: This Echo is possessed by an internal glitch. It randomly turns on and makes a noise similar to the Jaws theme song. It does it at night, during mute, even while a song is playing on it and it is louder than the song volume playing. No light turns on. It just makes this noise at different times of the day and night every day.

Using a brand-spanking new iPhone 7 (with latest sw upgrades), downloaded the Amazon Echo app from the Apple App store, and attempted an install. After prompt for Amazon username, and password, and a prompt to allow Echo to send prompts, I simply get a spinning wheel (and the Amazon Echo logo). Tried every workaround Amazon's posted (reset phone, kill app, delete and reinstall app, etc. to no avail. Next step is to try to reach Amazon tech support for assistance. This is a huge bummer, as it was a present for my wife. She's less than amused, and we're very close to a return. No wonder the app only has "2" stars on the site. We haven't even gotten to the "slowness of the app" part, as it won't install.
review_title: "2" Star Review Well Deserved - Very Close to a Product Return...

review_text: Unlike my new echo, this refurbished product would cut out audio about every hour, requiring power reset. review_text: Stopped working after 6 months. Don't buy this first generation Echo! Complete waste of money. Alexa will work for a few minutes after plugging her in, then her audio cuts out. I try to play music from Amazon Unlimited and Alexa only plays a sample from the album. Why am I paying for prime yearly and a subscription for "unlimited" music when it works 20% of the time. I wish i could return this waste of money but after only 2 months its no longer eligible. Wait a few more years before voice assistance is worth it.

I just see no added value to having this device when I can just go for the Dot for a quarter of the price (if I already haveBose speakers I can connect the Dot and Alexa to.

review_text: Need more improvements.

Apple is more expensive, but I have studied differential and absolute privacy, and they are doing it right.  I bought a HomePod to replace this.  I only use it for shopping lists, weather, music, etc., so Siri is just perfect for that.  And the HomePod sound is amazing. Bye, Alexa!

review_text: Not impressed at all. It was gift, so at least I didn’t have to pay for anything. It’s so disappointing that I can’t play any of the music off of my iPhone. I end up just using my UE Boom with Alexa capability most of the time.

Then we attempted to dsend the unit back for replacement, but received a message back saying this unit did not qualify for replacement. review_text: Greatly disappointed with this product! Worked for 3 months and then stopped. Can't get connected now so I called the number given for "network error".  What a joke! I was told that my internet connection had problems and therefore, I would need to pay $250 a year to have them correct the problem. No thank you. Frankly, I'm shocked that this would even happen with a supposed company of Amazon's stature.

I have had problems with the Echo since I originally purchased it on 6/17.  Contacted Amazon about problem and it took two different reps to finally get this returned for repairs.  When the unit was sent back to me, with a message that they had looked at it and it performed properly, I was hopeful that it was working properly.  Unfortunately it behaved exactly as before I sent it in. This devise will only stay on for a few hours then I hear a muffled pop which lets me know it is now not working.  I have to unplug the unit to get it responsive again.  Even doing their resetting instructions it does nothing but make me go though the initial set up again. I really doubt my unit was repaired, but rather just hooked up for a few minutes then returned.
review_title: Very poor product and just as poor customer service and repairs.

review_text: My Alexa is not minding me! Coming on at random and playing music at the highest level without being prompted to.  Woke up by music playing three times this early morning.  Cannot hear my command/screaming to stop!  WHAT'S UP WITH THAT??  Not a happy camper.

I bought my echo over a month ago from best buy but I did not decide to attempt to take it back until it was past the period to get a full refund. Thru out this time I have attempted to work with it. I bought it to listen to my amazon playlist which it does not do on a regular basis. I wake it up and most of the time the light does not stay on long enough to hear my request and if it does it circles around and doesn't play anything. when it does play its great but most of the time its just a bad ideal that is too expensive to through away.  I then use my radio. So if you do decide to buy one and it doesn't work take if back to get your refund.
review_title: A good ideal that did not work

review_text: I would love to say that I love this, and when it works I do. Unfortunately I can't get this to work as expected (with continual sound) and Amazon customer service is limited in the support that they can provide. I am on my second Echo, both have had an issue where they lose sound. When this device is first set up, and power cycled it works great, but within 24 hours it loses sound. It is still responsive and will follow commands, such as turn on a light, but no sound. So when I ask her the temperature I just see lights flashing. I wish that I could get this truly resolved, sending a replacement didn't solve the issue.

I have gone thru one exchange already, I'm on number two, and it is already giving me problems. The volume goes in and out, the voice command can't understand 3/4 of the time and it has a mind of it's own the rest of time. Really unhappy with it, it may just be the fact that they are refurbished? but I can't comment on a new one, but would say thtat's the route I would have, should have gone.

At first we loved this item. However, now you must pay for features that were free.  We loved the free music feature which is no longer available.  This was the main reason I purchased this item. I feel I was taken advantage of by Amazon.  We purchased this item in January by March we could not access the music feature unless we pay for it.  I feel we were taken advantage of by Amazon. Basically this  $200.00 item is a piece of junk to us I have no desire to pay to listen to music.  I'm an Amazon Prime member that purchases almost on a weekly basis.  I do not think this is any way to treat loyal customers.  My reviews of Amazon are no longer positive.

Alexa will start to respond, then she will just stop. Other times the light will turn red and she will tell me to try again later, I have to unplug her to get her working again. These problems happen intermittently. I've had her less than a month... I have one at work and haven't had these issues. Not a happy camper.

Very good sound quality, however after less than 1 year the device can’t stream music for more than 30 seconds without cutting out unexpectedly and for an indeterminate amount of time. This happens on this device as well as the echo dots I purchased, both individually and in any of the device groups I created. I reached out to support to ask about the issue and received a generic, vague response along the lines of “we are aware of the problem and are working on it” which needless to say is less than satisfactory. I must say I’m disappointed because when it worked I loved these devices! I’m back now to an old FM radio and/or the music channels on my tv.
review_title: Lasted less than a year- now cannot stream music at all

review_text: I hate this thing, voice itg is junk, everything is junk with this. Amazon will not give refund and they will probably delete this review.

Worked great for three months, but after that it mysteriously was no longer able to connect to our home internet. Our two Dots aren't haven't any trouble at all; this is unique to the Echo.  I followed all the instructions for a complete reset of the device, which takes about 20 minutes. Tried multiple times and it still didn't work.  Now it's collecting dust in my kitchen.
Two months after warranty ran out Alexa died. She will be missed.
just received my echo, refurbished, setting via my home wife, everything seem good.
review_title: everything seem good. but for 2 hours alexa or echo does ...

review_text: I really wanted to love me echo. The dots are awesome. However, the echo had an issue where the speaker sometimes cuts out when switching to the next song, and the only way to fix it was too reboot it. I contacted support and ended sending it back in for a replacement. Amazon sent it back refurbished instead, and with the same problem. So much for excellent customer support.

The Echo when you first unbox it is very interesting. It is sleek, smooth and is a lot lighter than you'd think. I had been shopping around for a good Bluetooth speaker when I came across Alexa. One of the best speakers for the price. There are a few glitches that still need worked out, but if you really want great sound, she'll get the job done. I know, it's a small speaker, but when turned all the way up, the quality doesn't lack, and it will definitely turn heads. As far as sound quality and ease of use, 10 out of 10, no question. When it comes to things that Alexa knows and questions you can ask, it is more limited than I imagined. Still a great purchase for the price
review_title: UPDATE - ALEXA DIED - LESS THAN 1 STAR

review_text: With minimal use and much care. I regret to say my Echo stopped working after 18months.
I stupidly bought this ""refurbished"" Amazon Echo.  It lasted to just past the item return cut off date. Now it won't stay connected  to

So let me get this straight?...I need to download the Alexa App--which is an Apple supported function---Yet, I cannot import my iTunes library??? When I ask Alexa to play a song, I get a SAMPLE, and not the entire song!? I am EXTREMELY Disappointed! Furthermore...it answered questions great---for about a day.  I just set Alexa up Aamir six hours ago. It was working great. Now everything I ask her, I'm getting the standard hon I did not understand the question I was asked" as a response. Are you kidding me? Such a Let down!!  Not nearly as helpful or accurate as it is on the commercial. Will likely return both Alexa AND the Dot, for this reason!

Every time I ask for the time or the weather or basically anything, this thing say something about what kind of day I should have!  WTF?!  JUST TELL ME THE TIME OR WEATHER!!!  It's a simple electronic device--why is it trying to act like it's my friend or something?  I've asked it to stop saying platitudes, called it an idiot, cursed at it hoping amazon would receive feedback and fix the stupid thing.  If you're looking for something for your home, you might be better off with a Google device.
review_title: Annoying me constantly by wishing me a happy ... anything!

review_text: After I had no success in setting up my Amazon Echo via the Amazon Alexa app for the iPhone (the most recent version of the app as of June 6, 2016), I almost gave up and decided to return the Echo for a full refund (which you can get up to 30 days). Then I tried to set up my Echo via my Mac, by going to http://alexa.amazon.com/ in my Mac web browser (it works in Safari or Chrome) and then following the setup sequence there, which worked fine and now my Echo is up and running OK. I am still giving the Echo only one star because I had a very time-wasting and frustrating experience trying to setup the Echo via via the current (latest) version of the iPhone Alexa app, which failed repeatedly on 6/6/2016. Almost all recent feedback posts for the iPhone Alexa app complain that the app fails to setup Alexa and give the app 1 star. Without getting Alexa setup, it cannot be used at all. I hope Amazon fixes their Alexa app for the iPhone, so other customers have the same unacceptable experience.
review_title: Alexa app on iPhone FAILS to setup Alexa, you must use either a Mac or another device for setup, NOT an iPhone

review_text: Received a bad device, returned it and never got my refund.  Just think newer models are better, I liked the spin dial on the first ones, but the newest ones have better sound quality.
review_title: Bad item, didn’t get a refund when returned, I give up on Amazon, trying other Google devices now.

review_text: I feel that this item should have lasted longer.  Warranty or no warranty, they only offered me a 15% discount on a replacement.  Because of the failure right after the warranty expired, I do NOT recommend this item, and will think hard before purchasing a replacement.  Oh did I mention that I was on hold for over 20 minutes during the chat.  Bad Customer service, which I am not used to from Amazon.
review_title: Warranty up less than 2 months ago, and it quits!

review_text: Action-based voice recognition is a great concept, the Echo is just horribly executed.  I've never been so angry at an inanimate object in my entire life; the fact that it was a gift is the sole reason that it hasn't met it's deserved fate of being chucked through Amazon HQ's window like the useless brick that it truly is.  Save your money, save your frustration, leave automation to devices that can actually do it effectively

Unfortunately, it took several calls to both Amazon and AT&T before someone pointed this it out to me.  I spent about 3 hours total trying to get Alexa to work.  Also one solution at one time was for me to open UDP ports on my routers firewall. THIS IS VERY DANGEROUS.  After you open these ports, someone finding those ports can exploit vulnerabilities in software on your home devices.  Almost all software is attackable.
review_title: Does not work with AT&T DSL router 7550 and Amazon gave dangerous advice to attempt a fix

review_text: Today, I stopped trusting Amazon.
review_title: I never thought I would say this...

review_text: Does not respond six feet away but the echo dot in the living room at the other end the house does.When you go in the living room you have to yell at the dot. Very aggravating.

i have noticed the volume for the alarm clock gradually getting more and more quiet with Alexa's voice still booming and rarely answering anything unless spelled out better written than wikipedia... today, my "alarm" was a quite peep peep peep, I woke by my dog, then i asked Alexa what time it was, "THE TIME IS 7:15 AM!!!!"... Echo is now in the garbage with no replacement coming
review_title: not even a good alarm clock

review_text: We loved this for about 6 months until today it just quit working. I've looked up options to fix it online but nothing is working. I'd like a replacement but it says it's not eligible for return.

Prepare to spend days on the phone with various help desks as you attempt to make it interface with the apps it claims to work with. It's not always smart to be an early adopter. This thing is not ready for prime time.

review_text: The only thing I have found this useful for is playing music, other than that every time I ask it a question it says "Sorry I don't have the answer to that question". review_text: Without warning, it simply stopped working.  I've had it for almost two years.  It worked great, that is until it died.  It doesn't power up or turn on anymore.  Great while it lasted, worthless now.

At first we loved our echo but suddenly it stopped working. Apparently it won't connect to the wifi network anymore. If we needed technical assistance we would have to pay around $200! My husband eventually spoke to someone to go through a process, but that just left us frustrated and holding a useless product we paid for. No one got back to us for a solution. Very disappointing.

review_text: Every time I tell Alexa to play the Thong Song by Sisquo, she gets really confused and plays the wrong thing. Turns out the Thong Song is her kryptonite.

It was good user experience at the beginning in 2016. But it became worse overtime, now after three years, it is completely broken. I turned the power off at night and then power on in the morning, then I found the flash light just rotate nonstop and I tried to reset by pushing the bottom. No matter how hard I tried, it refused to go back to normal and start. Can't get this thing repaired or fixed after I contacted Amazon service rep. What a waste. Guess I won't try Amazon sound product again.
review_title: Quality turned bad after long use

review_text: Great concept.  However, if you use a VPN, this item didn't meet expectations.  Anytime I activated my vpn, the unit disconnected from my wifi and it was useless.  I tried just setting it up with my iphone instead of my laptop.  Though connected through the iphone, whenever I activated my VPN, the Echo dropped the connection and again was useless.  Good thing I purchased it on sale.  Makes a cool paper weight!

Really this thing can't do much of anything useful, can't answer questions from the web, can't launch skills without using the direct  name which is usually something not too easy to remember. The biggest issue I have is connecting to the damn thing to set it up takes over 10 minutes usually which makes me want to throw it through the window and get a google home.
review_title: Waste of time, can't even connect.

review_text: The Amazon Echo was barely used and it started having problems about 9 months into it but didn’t think twice since it wasn’t used much.  Then I tried to use it to place an order a few days ago and realized it was defective (less than 13 months).  Technical support confirmed that it was defective and the best they could do was a $30 credit towards a new device since it was out of warranty.  I had also bought another Echo in July but never connected it.  I am reluctant to use that one due to the experience above.  Just disappointed that amazon did not stand behind their product better.  It should not have failed under a year with minimal usage.

Bought this as a gift for my husband. He just opened it up and went to set it up rock find that it isn’t working. Super disappointed. Called customer service and they are replacing it but in order to replace it we had to discuss the price, how I paid for it etc. which really ruined the gift element. ☹️

While initially Alexa was great, she has recently developed a glitch which causes here to lose her voice. Rebooting restores it but these episodes are becoming more frequent. I have not yet attempted to resolve the issue. When I have, I may change my rating.

Bought 2. I have tried for months to love them. After a few weeks they essentially became Bluetooth speakers for my phone until recently they weren't even working for that. Now they buzz in and out in a weird way.they stop in the middle of the song then pick up 10 seconds later exactly where they left off so the speaker it's self is not broken it's just stopping relay the information that's coming over Bluetooth.

Hardly used over a period of time.  Will not turn on.  Checked the power cord and it is providing 15 VDC to the unit.  Still won't turn on.  Made sure the power cord is plugged into the unit tight and still would not work.  Very disappointed. It always sat on the counter and then for no reason stopped working.  There is no way to repair/fix it.
Cute and entertaining.  But also nosy.  Listening all the time.  Unplugged it after a few months.  Your tv will activate it unintentionally.  Like your privacy?  Don’t get this device.

This is a scam. Other than having a good speaker, which Ankor sells for 25 dollars, Alexa may tell you the news, time, weather. So does any internet device. Amazon has this thing built up to sell you more and more crap. For what, I have no clue. This is Amazon's First Generation - let's see how we can con people and take their hard earned money!
review_title: Amazon Scam! Get a Anchor Speaker! Save your Money!

review_text: Disappointed at best.  If you want to automate your home maybe it's the next best thing.  But I don't get answers to my questions.

I have had the worst luck with this device. Continuously has to be reset to get to work and will spontaneously just stop working for no reason. The Dot that I have is fine. This has been a lemon and unfortunately my return window has closed.

My device has to be reset 1 to 2 times a day because it loses it's capability to talk. Basically the internal speakers seem to stop working. It lights up as if it responds and the app on my phone indicates it did, but you don't hear a thing. It's basically become a very expensive paper weight. I reached out to Amazon technical support and they had me default it with no luck. It's been over 30 days since I purchased this device and cannot return it. My hopes are that Amazon steps up and either replaces my device or gives me a full return. Currently waiting for them to respond. Unfortunately, I had to give 1 star. Review will not allow less.

I thought I loved this device. It was just what I needed. I bought it in November, I had an issue in May with power. They sent a replacement. It didn't seem to work as well. You had to call the name several times before it would answer on most occasions. I got pass that. I get up this morning and it will not come on at all. I still have 6 days on my warranty but they can't just send me a replacement. They have to get this one back then try to fix it and possibly return the same one saying it's fixed. In the meantime my 6 days of warranty will expire once I get that supposingly fixed one back. I don't understand why they can't ship a replacement and figure out their issue with this one without me having to wait 2-4 weeks for a replacement. I paid for something to last more than a year and I shouldn't have to wait for them to investigate their problem. The tech tells me I'm not the first to complain about this same issue. Really Now

I had this refurbished items for one year and one month and it just died on me. For the price, I expected it to work much longer. I am really disappointed.  I do not see any way to contact Amazon about this issue. It is a refurbished items so I would think they would allow returns If the item stopped working.

Bought in September 2016 and in just about a year it's already broken.  Had it on the counter playing music and then it just stopped, wouldn't respond and didn't appear to have any power. It was plugged into a power strip with every other device on the strip still working, tried plugging directly into the wall outlet and still would not power on.
review_title: Bought in September 2016 and in just about a year ...

review_text: Worked for 11 months then no response. I have to unplug it and plug it back to restart to get it to work for 24 to 48 hours and then back to the same issue. Called customer service and the best solution they gave me is to reset which I had been doing for 6 months with no resolution to the issue. In addition, lots of times Alexa have no clue what i’m asking. If you buy one, just don’t have any hopes that it will function for more than one year.
review_title: Doesn’t last more than a year

review_text: It can't connect, it can't stay connected, it can't do this .. it can't do that and I can't abide it any longer.  It's a kitty litter box ornament.  It can do that though my cat doesn't like it much either.

I live in a 1000 sq ft apt. I bought the 2nd Alexa in order to avoid raising the volume from one room to another. Although my condo is tiny, the amazon plus for music doesn’t extend to my other one. It says I have to pay for a family plan to hear unlimited music even though I paid for a second Alexa. I would have been better off turning volume up in the other room vs buying a 2nd Alexa. Ridiculous! I already pay for Amazon music unlimited and prime
review_title: Don’t get 2 in one small household

review_text: This product is just a glorified speaker. It can't answer simple questions like, "what are good remedies for......".  The logic is very poor and is unable to search for simple things.  It is way over hyped.  It was fun to play Jeopardy on but now they're pushing marketing through that game.

Our echo stoped working within the first few months. It  just wouldn’t turn on then itd work again. It rarely understood my commands and it was frustrating to repeat myself. After a year of it  only working 1/4 of the time it stopped turning on all together. This is an expensive device to only get to use a dozen times bf it does completely.

We bought this and after the first month every once in a while you have to keep unplugging it and plugging it back in to get it to work. we contacted customer service and we were sent to support to no avail. then it started happening weekly and now its daily> Support has asked for records and went into the alexa app and so on. Still waiting for them to call us back. By the way we bought this back in April. We now know if its an Amazon product./. expect no help.,. but any other product we purchased that wasn't owned by amazon,.,immediate results.,.go figure.
review_title: We bought this and after the first month every once ...

review_text: I purchased this item July 2018,  after setting it up it worked fine for about an hour....  I had to reboot and it worked fine for about an hour  since then I have rebooted and reconfigured this device several time. with the same results...  I've spent a lot of time trying to figurer out how to get service...  The devise has been stored since Aug when I give up....  Service might be good if you can find it...  very frustrated...  a prime customer

Worked fine for a few months, then "she" stopped talking... Now I must reboot it every single day when I give a command and the light on top just spins around - no verbal response. Perhaps Amazon could send an online patch or update since it's a WiFi device...?

Randomly stopped working. Our Echo has worked well for the last year or so. We honestly don't use it for much, but it at least worked. Within the last month, it has stopped working consistently. It is having more trouble understanding us and says it is losing its connection to the internet. I have attempted to restore it, but that has not helped. Completely unreliable. I'm kind of fed up with Amazon's devices, they're great at first, but they get so buggy and become unreliable. I would not recommend it.

Bought refurbished because new 1st Generation were no longer available, and wanted it for the better speaker quality. However, had problems with it - it will work when it's first plugged in and restarted, but that only lasts for maybe a day or two max. So whenever I know i'm going to be using it, i have to unplug it and restart so i can use it with my other speakers for music.
review_title: Refurbished is not the way to go

review_text: The echo is so slow at completing tasks. It’s easier to use the app on my iPhone to manage my smart lights and switches. Or use Siri. She takes forever to turn something on or off. She’s only quick when I’m firing off tasks. Replacement echo didn’t resolve the issue. Now Amazon wants to refund it, at almost $30 less than what I paid for it.

Only device in the house that constantly disconnects from network. Use to run great but in the last month it cannot stay connected.  It is not my home network as none of the other devices have any issues.  Will have to eventually replace the until but will not be getting another Amazon device.  I hear the Google device is better anyway as there is no need to install skills like Echo requires.  Very disappointed in this device as it only worked a few months.
review_title: Use to run great but in the last month it cannot stay connected

review_text: This worked wonderfully with no issues. Recently audio drop off has occurred and volume is roughly half what it was. Maybe once an hour it flashes back to normal volume and then is extremely loud. Idea for headaches not radio music, disspointing to fail so quickly with no support.

The Amazon Echo seemed like a great concept, a voice assistant. Who wouldn't love that? I've had my Echo for a few years and I have learned that these things were only designed and built to last for a few years. For the price, $179.99+, you would think these would last for more than a few years. Mine hardly works now. I have been using it as it was designed to be used. It sits on a book case. Now, it hardly responds to my voice, even when I'm standing right over it, it hardly works. I even have the voice controlled remote and even with that it still hardly works. I do everything to trouble shoot it, unplug it, disconnect and reconnect it to the internet wifi. Nothing seems to help. Working with the Alexa app is a joke, the app hardly ever opens or loads. When it does open, it freezes up and you have to close it and restart it. The Echo doesn't connect to other devices via wifi like it should, when I try to connect it, it always says out of range, even standing right next to the thing, still out of range. The Echo seems like a good idea, but it's poorly designed and built.
review_title: Don't buy. Does not last long.

review_text: Can't answer simple questions like "what President came after Nixon?"

The Echo hardware stopped working 4 months after the year warranty so I was out $195 total. We have 2 others that are still working so we do love the product but Amazon has to get better hardware or extend their warranty. I don't see myself buying another until the warranty is extended or they are on sale for 50% off again. Customer support did offer a 15% discount on a new one but I can't be buying one every year.
review_title: We have 2 others that are still working so we do love the product but Amazon has to get better hardware or extend their warranty

review_text: after waiting for delivery, I was excited to get the Echo and put it to work.  Unfortunately it does not work yet.  I had difficulty in setup.  It will not auto connect to my phone, there is no windows application so I cannot get it to work from any of my tablets (YES ALL WINDOWS), from my Android phone.  It will connect to the phone application, but will not connect to my network.  it is within 2 feet of my router, so it is clearly not a signal strength issue.

My alexa randomly stopped listening to me for no apparent reason. I barely used it when I got it, but when I actually needed it, she did not come through. I need a new one asap. Everyone keeps asking me about these things, but I will not have anything nice to say about it, especially if I can not get a new one.

My Echo arrived with an add-on I did not order. When I opened the shipping box I was startled to see several ants run out of the box (strange). As I tried to ease the Echo from the outer box, more ants swarmed up to the surface (yech). Not those cute little ones, but rather those Mutant Ninja sized ones (but not quite so big as those carpenter ants so I guess just over-achieving or, perhaps irradiated regular ants or, out of work/shape carpenter ants). I should have stopped here to entertain rational thought and should have photographed the moment for posterity.  However, being in my KITCHEN and sensing the mounting coup, at this point "I chose violence" and ran outside with the box at arms length - that squealing sound you may have heard was, no doubt, me. Once outside, I pull the plastic bagged Echo the remaining way out of the box. Mistake. (GROSS!) The box is loaded with ants - ants running up my hands, ants running willy-nilly to confuse me, ants carrying eggs (EGGS people!  They are clearly in this for the long-haul!), ants that apparently died in the effort of delivering my Echo (these are the only vaguely appreciated ants).  This war could have been waged  in my KITCHEN (ants are insidious planners!). The ants take their job seriously and are even guarding the interior of the Echo packaging itself.  I think I saw a sovereign flag. I know now that they have  territorialized the Echo's electronic components.  I fear the consequences of enabling Alexa with electricity.  I have seen Ant Man.  I have no desire to see a sequel in my own kitchen.  While I fought bravely, I now stare defeat in the face and accept it.  I will return to you Amazonians the Echo habitat you originally sent me. Perhaps some of the hostiles have survived to tell their tale.  Perhaps their breeding program continues deep in the heart of Alexa and you will understand that Winter is Not coming fast enough.  I await a replacement for my Echo with one without hostile add-on components.  I rate this product accordingly until I am sure the wall holds in the North and the invaders are vanquished at their source.

This is a great product but the fact they sold this "as a deal", then introduced the new product for the same "deal" price is pretty crappy. I am happy with the product but seriously, this was a sham. It should have been a better deal since it as being discontinued. Boo on AMAZON.COM, seriously BOO!
review_title: Sham all the way. BOO to Amazon.com

review_text: I got as a gift but the fact that you have to memorize every skill with insane long commands is crazy so good luck with Google home around the corner but my hopes are high that amazon will fix it.

Had it less than1.5 years and its stopped working. For something that cost almost $200 I expected to get more use out of it. Especially since it was stored for 6 months while moving. Tried rebooting it and it worked for a few more days now its just dead.
Does not last.  Keeps malfunctioning (does not respond) then have to unplug and reset it.  Will work for a few hours then the same

I have tried getting getting it hooked up to my Dish Hopper and after following all the instructions the Echo responds back that they cannot access at this time.  Maybe if they fix the app etc. I will like it better

This thing makes a great speaker for your music. That's the only good thing I have to say about it. Amazon, you sucked me right in with all the hype. I have to constantly unplug and plug this back in to get it to work. It malfunctions daily! YES, I did try resetting it MULTIPLE TIMES!

Just a simple novelty.  Alexa is terrible at doing things you request.  I think she is going deaf!!! Seems like she worked much better when I first got her.  Not at all happy.  You have to scream at her to get her to listen and even then, she doesn't seem to understand English.

Alexa is a bad thing!  Everything you say is recorded and stored in the cloud permanently even if you don't ask it a question.  Law enforcement can have that recording subpoenaed at their choosing to use against you in a court of law. Think about it.  Why would you allow Alexa that capability?

review_text: Loved it at first and all of a sudden it stopped working. I barely used it and now it doesn't turn on. I'm very angry and super disappointed. I can't believe I spend all this money for a piece of junk!

No warning - just inability to power up.  For a pricey item as this is, and considering I have had TV's last 15 years with more violatile parts, this must be a quality issue of parts sourced.
review_title: Nice when it works - went dead overnight.

review_text: With so many glowing reviews of the Echo, I had high hopes that Echo/Alexa would make a great addition to my household. The quality of the physical appliance (Echo) is very good: Great sound quality and the microphone technology is like "NSA eavesdropping" good!.  The physical hardware gets 4.5/5 stars, but here's the bad news: Alexa is absolutely horrible right now! The software quality of core Alexa system (not the skills or 3rd party additions) is poor and it makes for a disappointing experience.  When it comes to the "canned" requests/commands, Alexa will respond as expected about 95% of the time. However, if you go "off script" with Alexa, it will completely fail with robotic precision about 95% of the time.  You probably have seen the commercial where people are carrying on conversations with Alexa or asking it seemingly complex questions (and Alexa responds with spot on answers)... It's not like that at all! It's not even creative when it fails to answer questions. I've heard "Sorry, I couldn't find the answer to your question" more times than I care to.
review_title: Echo gets an 'A+', while Alexa is sent home with an 'F' and a note to her parents...

review_text: I want a refund!!!  This is now the second Echo product that just stops working...or works intermittently which is probably worse.  Basic problem is inability to connect to the network or doing so when it feels like it.  The other Echo add on product (the speaker set up that you plop a Dot into) is garbage (50% failure rate, one of two).  won't work despite being plugged in.  ......so much for new technology...

review_text: Bought it in June 2015, stopped powering on in Nov 2019. Decided not to get another one since we barely used it anyway. Plus all the stories about the snooping made us cautious about using it in the family room.

No changes had been made to the network, all other devices still can connect. I tried all of the troubleshooting and it would not reconnect. I don't know if it is designed obsolescence or what, but I'm not going to replace the device with a new one if it's also gonna die.

The Echo worked fine for a year and three months and then it failed to connect to the internet.  Resetting it to factory defaults and going through setup didn't work.  Running lower levels of security on wireless (even none as a test) didn't work.  I spent some time with 1st level tech support and a little more with 2nd level tech support but still have no idea what the problem is. We reconnect and after 5 minutes Alexa says "Sorry I am having trouble right now.  Try again later".  We have tried to reinstall the APP, reset to manufacturer settings, rebooted router many times and still get the same message.  We are very disappointed that we wasted $90.

It’s fixed by resetting the device (unplugging and plug back in) but now it needs to be done multiple times per week. Doesn’t last the test of time.

They said they were working on it to reverse the software update that caused the issue but here in April, I still can not use my echo. review_text: This SHOULD be a great product. It does sound and function terrifically, UNTIL it falls over because it is top-heavy, which is a design flaw, if it is indeed a flaw in design. We advance purchased this for my son who waited patiently for it for months. At first he loved it. He has taken great care of this device, but it was very slightly bumped over and fell onto his desktop which caused the top to pop off. He tried to make it work, which for awhile it did, but the top kept popping off and now it doesn't work, which is not great, especially since we paid so much for the unit. The unit was broken in May, but he tried to work around the problem. Now that popping the top on doesn't work, we can't send it back for repair, since it is now out of warranty (June 2016). We really love the idea here, but the design is flawed. Now we see cases on Amazon which help keep the Echo from falling over, which really shouldn't have been such an issue.
review_title: Flawed Design Causes Echo to Fall Over

review_text: HUGE HUGE HUGE SECURITY HOLE. ANYONE with a Bluetooth device can connect to this within range. There is NO PIN or any security to prevent someone from connecting to this device. I discovered this when the device reported my neighbor had connected via Bluetooth WITHOUT me doing anything. I was told by "Amazon" that the person connecting "couldn't do anything with it". They pretty much blew me off and opened a "trouble ticket" that went into an Amazon black hole. I'm no expert on Bluetooth, but seems like someone could connect and do malicious stuff with your device. In theory they could order stuff from Amazon Prime, control home automation, open your doors (if you have locks supported by Alexa), and the list goes on and on. What would prevent some "bad guy" from walking by your house, connecting to your device and gathering all kinds of information.

review_text: The concept itself is amazing with huge potential, however its Quickly becoming a sad excuse for a trivia box.  I check for the newest skills (which is just a fancy name for apps) quite often to find mostly stupid individualized nonsense .  While that may prove to be a nice gimmick for some, there are still many issues that need to be addressed for the echoes usefulness.  It's being marketed as a personal assistant and in my opinion that is where it's lacking the most...!  It can take messages, notes, shopping list, etc.  But has no way of getting that information back to you.  When an alarm or timer goes off, you better remember why you set it or you will have to go looking in the app for that info when echo could have simply read it back to you with a simple app.  A simple app could enable the echo to e-mail, text or even Skype any relevant information making it way more productive as an assistant.  If Amazon engineers want the echo to be a huge success and not turn into the next fad flop, I would suggest starting with inexpensive android watch and attempt to meet or exceed its functionality which is leaps and bounds ahead of the Amazon Echo.
I'm disappointed with Alexa as a device with the ability to search for and report information. My tablet is a better device to get information quickly
